Keep your shoulders packed down and back.

name: Close-Grip Dumbbell Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on a bench with two dumbbells. Press them up and hold them close together.
Lower the dumbbells to your chest, keeping them close.
Keep your elbows tucked in.
Press the dumbbells back up.
form_cues: Squeeze the dumbbells together hard at the top.
Keep your elbows close to your ribs on the way down.
Maintain a slight arch in your upper back.
common_mistakes: Bouncing the weights off your chest.
injury_prevention_tips: Ensure you have control of the dumbbells before starting.
Do not let your wrists bend backward.

name: Close-Grip EZ-Bar Curl with Band
beginner_friendly_instructions: Loop bands around the ends of an EZ bar. Stand on the middle of the bands.
Grab the bar with a close, underhand grip.
Curl the bar up toward your shoulders, keeping elbows at your sides.
Lower the bar slowly.
form_cues: Keep your elbows pinned to your sides.
Squeeze your biceps at the top.
common_mistakes: Swinging your body to lift the weight.
injury_prevention_tips: Check that the bands are securely anchored under your feet.
Keep your wrists neutral.

name: Close-Grip EZ-Bar Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on a bench with an EZ bar. Grip the bar with hands close together.
Unrack the bar and lower it to your lower chest.
Keep your elbows tucked in.
Press the bar back up.
form_cues: Keep your feet flat on the floor.
common_mistakes: Bouncing the bar off the chest.
injury_prevention_tips: Use a spotter.
Ensure the EZ bar is loaded evenly.

name: Close-Grip Push-Up off of a Dumbbell
beginner_friendly_instructions: Place two dumbbells on the floor shoulder-width apart.
Get into a plank position holding the dumbbells, keeping your hands close together.
Lower your chest toward the dumbbells, keeping elbows tucked.
Press back up.
form_cues: Keep your body in a straight line.
Keep your elbows tucked close to your sides.
injury_prevention_tips: Ensure the dumbbells are stable and won't roll.
If you have wrist issues, this may be uncomfortable; stop if pain occurs.

name: Cocoons
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on your back with arms extended overhead and legs straight.
Simultaneously bring your knees to your chest and your arms forward over your head.
Try to touch your hands to your feet (or shins).
Return to the starting position with control.
form_cues: Keep your lower back pressed into the floor.
common_mistakes: Using momentum to swing your limbs.
Letting your lower back arch off the floor.
Not fully extending arms and legs at the start.
injury_prevention_tips: If you feel neck strain, keep your chin tucked.
Move slowly to ensure muscle engagement.

name: Cross Over - With Bands
beginner_friendly_instructions: Anchor a resistance band to a sturdy post at chest height.
Stand sideways to the post and grab the band with the far hand.
Pull the band across your chest, extending your arm.
Return to the start slowly.
common_mistakes: Using your shoulder to pull instead of your chest.
injury_prevention_tips: Check the anchor point is secure.
Do not overstretch the band.

name: Crossover Reverse Lunge
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
Step one foot back and behind the opposite leg (crossing it).
Lower your hips until your back knee almost touches the floor.
Return to standing and repeat on the other side.
form_cues: Cross the leg far enough to feel a stretch in the hip.
common_mistakes: Letting your front knee cave inward.
injury_prevention_tips: Hold onto a wall for balance if needed.
Ensure your front knee tracks over your toes.

name: Crunch - Legs On Exercise Ball
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on your back and place your lower legs/feet on top of a stability ball.
Keep your knees bent at 90 degrees.
Place hands lightly behind your head and crunch your shoulders off the floor.
Lower back down with control.
form_cues: Press your lower back into the floor.
common_mistakes: Using momentum to swing your shoulders up.
injury_prevention_tips: Ensure the ball is inflated properly.
If you feel neck pain, place your hands on your chest instead.

name: Cuban Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand holding light dumbbells with palms facing forward.
Raise your elbows to shoulder height (scarecrow position).
Rotate your forearms up and overhead (external rotation).
Press the dumbbells overhead, then reverse the steps.
injury_prevention_tips: Start very light to protect the rotator cuff.
Stop if you feel pinching in the shoulder.

name: Deadlift with Bands
beginner_friendly_instructions: Loop resistance bands over the barbell and anchor them to the floor or rack.
Set up for a conventional deadlift: feet hip-width, grip the bar.
Lift the bar by extending hips and knees, keeping the bar close.
Lower the bar to the floor with control.
form_cues: Push the floor away with your feet.
common_mistakes: Letting the bands pull you forward.
injury_prevention_tips: Ensure the bands are securely anchored.
Start with lighter bands to get used to the tension.

name: Deadlift with Chains
beginner_friendly_instructions: Drape chains over the barbell so they hang off the ends.
Set up for a conventional deadlift.
Lift the bar, lifting the chains off the floor as you rise.
Lower the bar, letting the chains pile up on the floor.
form_cues: Keep the bar close to your shins.
injury_prevention_tips: Ensure the chains are not too heavy for the bar collars.
Use a smooth floor surface for the chains.

name: Barbell Decline Bench Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set up on a decline bench, securing your legs.
Grip the barbell slightly wider than shoulder-width.
Lower the bar to your lower chest.
Press the bar back up.
common_mistakes: Bouncing the bar off the chest.
injury_prevention_tips: Use a spotter.
Ensure your legs are securely padded to prevent slipping.

name: Decline Close-Grip Bench To Skull Crusher
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on a decline bench with a close grip on the bar.
Perform a close-grip press: lower to lower chest, press up.
Immediately lower the bar toward your forehead (skull crusher motion).
Press back up to the starting position.
form_cues: Keep elbows tucked for the press.
Keep elbows stationary for the skull crusher.
common_mistakes: Flaring elbows during the skull crusher.
Bouncing the bar on the chest or forehead.
injury_prevention_tips: Use a spotter.
Stop immediately if you feel elbow pain.

name: Dumbbell Decline Bench Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on a decline bench with dumbbells at your chest.
Press the dumbbells up and slightly inward.
Lower the dumbbells to the sides of your chest.
Press back up.
form_cues: Keep your elbows at a 45-degree angle.
Squeeze your chest at the top.
common_mistakes: Letting dumbbells drift too far out.
injury_prevention_tips: Ensure dumbbells are secure in your grip.
Use a spotter if unsure.

name: Decline Dumbbell Flyes
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on a decline bench with dumbbells held above your chest.
Open your arms out to the sides in a wide arc.
Lower until you feel a stretch in your chest.
Bring the dumbbells back up, squeezing your chest.
form_cues: Keep a slight bend in your elbows.
Move through the shoulder joint, not the elbow.
common_mistakes: Lowering too low, risking shoulder strain.
injury_prevention_tips: Use lighter weights to master the form.
Stop if you feel shoulder pinching.

name: Decline Dumbbell Triceps Extension
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on a decline bench with two dumbbells held overhead.
Lower the dumbbells behind your head by bending your elbows.
Keep your elbows tucked in.
Extend your arms back up.
injury_prevention_tips: Ensure you have a spotter or can safely bail.
Keep wrists straight.

name: Decline EZ Bar Triceps Extension
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on a decline bench with an EZ bar overhead.
Lower the bar behind your head by bending your elbows.
Keep elbows tucked in.
Extend arms back up.
injury_prevention_tips: Ensure you have a spotter.
Keep wrists neutral.

name: Decline Push-Up
beginner_friendly_instructions: Place your feet on a bench or box and hands on the floor.
Lower your chest to the floor.
Keep your body in a straight line.
Press back up.
form_cues: Keep your elbows at a 45-degree angle.
injury_prevention_tips: Ensure the bench is stable.
If too hard, elevate your hands instead of feet.

name: Decline Smith Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set a decline bench in a Smith machine.
Grip the bar slightly wider than shoulder-width.
Lower the bar to your lower chest.
Press the bar back up.
common_mistakes: Bouncing the bar off the chest.
injury_prevention_tips: Ensure the safety catches are set correctly.
Do not unhook the bar if you are unsure.

name: Deficit Deadlift
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand on a 1-3 inch platform (plates or wood).
Grip the barbell on the floor below you.
Lift the bar by extending hips and knees, keeping the bar close.
Lower the bar to the floor with control.
form_cues: Push the floor away with your feet.
Keep the bar close to your shins.
common_mistakes: Rounding your back due to the increased range of motion.
Letting the bar drift away from your body.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with a very small deficit and increase gradually.
Ensure your hamstrings are flexible enough for the range.

name: Dips (Chest Focus)
beginner_friendly_instructions: Grip the parallel bars and jump up.
Lean your torso forward slightly.
Lower yourself until your shoulders are below your elbows.
Press back up, keeping the forward lean.
form_cues: Keep your elbows flared out slightly.
common_mistakes: Going too deep, risking shoulder injury.
injury_prevention_tips: If you feel shoulder pain, stop and reduce depth.
Use assistance bands if you cannot do a full rep.

name: Dips (Triceps Focus)
beginner_friendly_instructions: Grip the parallel bars and jump up.
Keep your torso upright.
Lower yourself until your elbows are at 90 degrees.
Press back up, keeping elbows tucked.
form_cues: Keep your elbows tucked close to your body.
injury_prevention_tips: Stop if you feel shoulder pinching.
Use assistance bands if needed.

name: Donkey Calf Raises
beginner_friendly_instructions: Bend forward and place your hands on the handles of the donkey calf machine.
Place the balls of your feet on the block.
Raise your heels as high as possible.
Lower your heels until you feel a stretch.
form_cues: Keep your legs straight (do not bend knees).
Pause at the top and squeeze.
injury_prevention_tips: Ensure the weight is balanced and secure.
Do not round your lower back.

name: Double Kettlebell Alternating Hang Clean
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, kettlebells between feet.
Hinge at hips, keep back flat, and grip kettlebells.
Explosively drive hips forward to clean one kettlebell to shoulder while the other drops.
Alternate which kettlebell you clean each rep in a fluid motion.
form_cues: Keep the kettlebell close to your body during the clean.
Use hip drive, not arm pull, to elevate the weight.
Absorb the landing with your legs, not your lower back.
common_mistakes: Using arms to lift instead of hips.
Letting the kettlebell drift away from the body.
Rounding the back during the hinge.
injury_prevention_tips: Maintain a neutral spine throughout the movement.
Start with light weight to master the timing.

name: Double Kettlebell Jerk
beginner_friendly_instructions: Clean two kettlebells to your shoulders, palms facing forward.
Dip your knees slightly, then explosively drive up with your legs.
As you drive, press the kettlebells overhead to full lockout.
Return feet to the ground and lower weights to shoulders for next rep.
form_cues: Keep torso upright during the dip.
Use a powerful leg drive to initiate the press.
Lock out elbows and stabilize shoulders at the top.
common_mistakes: Pressing with arms only, skipping the leg drive.
injury_prevention_tips: Ensure shoulders are stable and not shrugged up.
Practice the movement without weight first.

name: Double Kettlebell Push Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Clean two kettlebells to your shoulders, palms forward.
Slightly bend your knees and quickly drive up with your legs.
Use the leg momentum to help press the kettlebells overhead.
Lower the weights back to shoulders and repeat.
form_cues: Keep elbows pointing forward, not flared out.
Drive through your heels, not toes.
Press only as much as your legs help you.
common_mistakes: Pressing too early before leg drive.
Leaning back too much at the top.
Letting knees cave inward during the dip.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep core braced to protect the lower back.
Avoid locking out elbows too forcefully.

name: Double Kettlebell Snatch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand with kettlebells behind feet, hinge at hips to grip.
Swing kettlebells between legs, then explosively drive hips forward.
Keep arms straight as you pull the kettlebells upward.
Finish by locking them overhead in one smooth motion.
form_cues: Keep the kettlebells close to your body during the pull.
Punch through at the top to lock out.
common_mistakes: Overextending the lower back at the top.
Letting kettlebells drift away from the body.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with single kettlebell snatches before doubles.
Keep wrists neutral to avoid strain.

name: Double Kettlebell Windmill
beginner_friendly_instructions: Press one kettlebell overhead, keep it locked out.
Turn feet out slightly, push hips back to the side of the raised arm.
Lower your free hand to the floor while keeping eyes on the overhead bell.
Pause, then reverse the motion to stand.
form_cues: Keep the overhead kettlebell locked out and stable.
Keep chest open and spine neutral.
common_mistakes: Looking down instead of at the overhead weight.
Rounding the back during the hinge.
Over-bending the knees instead of hips.
injury_prevention_tips: Use a lighter weight to master mobility.
Ensure shoulder stability before loading heavy.

name: Downward Facing Balance
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie face down on an exercise ball.
Walk hands forward until ball is under your hips.
Extend arms and legs to lift body off the ball.
Hold the position, balancing on the ball.
form_cues: Engage glutes and core to stabilize.
Keep neck neutral, looking at the floor.
common_mistakes: Letting hips sag onto the ball.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with shorter holds and build up.
Use a wall for support if balance is poor.

name: Drag Curl
beginner_friendly_instructions: Hold barbell with palms facing up, elbows close to torso.
Keep elbows back as you curl the bar upward.
Drag the bar up your torso, keeping it in contact.
Lower slowly, maintaining contact.
form_cues: Elbows should travel backward, not flare out.
common_mistakes: Using momentum to lift the bar.
injury_prevention_tips: Avoid excessive weight that causes form breakdown.
Keep wrists neutral to avoid strain.

name: Dumbbell Clean
beginner_friendly_instructions: Hold dumbbells at sides, feet shoulder-width.
Hinge at hips to lower weights, keeping back flat.
Explosively extend hips and knees to drive dumbbells up.
Catch dumbbells at shoulders in a quarter squat, then stand.
form_cues: Keep dumbbells close to your body.
Use hip extension, not arm pull.
Absorb the catch with your legs.
common_mistakes: Rounding the back during the hinge.
injury_prevention_tips: Start light to learn the timing.
Keep core braced throughout.

name: Dumbbell Floor Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on floor, hold dumbbells above chest, arms extended.
Lower dumbbells until upper arms touch the floor.
Pause briefly, then press back up to start.
Keep elbows tucked or flared based on target muscle.
form_cues: Keep wrists straight and stacked over elbows.
Maintain a slight arch in the back.
common_mistakes: Letting elbows drift too far out.
injury_prevention_tips: Use a neutral grip if shoulder discomfort occurs.
Dont let dumbbells fall uncontrollably.

name: Dumbbell Flyes
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on bench, hold dumbbells above chest, palms facing each other.
Slightly bend elbows and keep them fixed.
Lower dumbbells out to sides until chest stretches.
Squeeze chest to return dumbbells to start.
form_cues: Imagine hugging a tree at the bottom.
Keep elbows slightly bent and fixed.
Move at the shoulder joint only.
common_mistakes: Bending elbows more during the movement.
injury_prevention_tips: Avoid excessive range of motion if shoulders hurt.
Use lighter weights to maintain control.

name: Dumbbell Incline Shoulder Raise
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on incline bench, hold dumbbells at shoulders.
Press dumbbells overhead, arms straight.
Lift shoulders off bench while pressing up.
Lower shoulders back to bench as you lower weights.
form_cues: Shrug shoulders up at the top.
common_mistakes: Using arms instead of shoulders to lift.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with light weight to avoid neck strain.
Keep core engaged to stabilize torso.

name: Dumbbell Lying One-Arm Rear Lateral Raise
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie face down on incline bench, hold dumbbell in one hand.
Let arm hang down, palm facing torso.
Raise dumbbell to side until arm is parallel to floor.
Lower slowly back down.
form_cues: Keep arm straight but not locked.
common_mistakes: Using momentum to swing the weight.
injury_prevention_tips: Use light weight to protect rotator cuff.
Avoid jerky movements.

name: Dumbbell Lying Rear Lateral Raise
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie face down on incline bench, hold dumbbells in both hands.
Let arms hang down, palms facing torso.
Raise both dumbbells to sides until arms are parallel to floor.
Lower slowly back down.
form_cues: Keep arms straight but not locked.
common_mistakes: Using momentum to swing the weights.
injury_prevention_tips: Use light weight to protect rotator cuff.
Avoid jerky movements.

name: Dumbbell One-Arm Shoulder Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit or stand with one dumbbell at shoulder.
Press dumbbell overhead until arm is straight.
Lower back to shoulder slowly.
Complete all reps on one side before switching.
form_cues: Keep core braced to avoid leaning.
Press straight up, not forward or back.
common_mistakes: Leaning too far to the side.
Using legs to assist (unless push press).
injury_prevention_tips: Use a bench for back support if needed.
Start light to build shoulder stability.

name: Dumbbell One-Arm Triceps Extension
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand or sit, hold one dumbbell overhead with both hands.
Lower dumbbell behind head, keeping elbows in.
Extend arms to lift dumbbell back up.
Keep upper arms stationary.
form_cues: Keep core engaged to avoid arching back.
common_mistakes: Moving upper arms during the rep.
injury_prevention_tips: Use lighter weight to avoid elbow strain.
Avoid dropping weight behind head quickly.

name: Dumbbell One-Arm Upright Row
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand with dumbbell in one hand, arm extended down.
Pull dumbbell straight up close to body.
Lead with elbow, stop when elbow is at shoulder height.
Lower slowly back down.
form_cues: Keep dumbbell close to your torso.
common_mistakes: Using momentum to swing the weight.
injury_prevention_tips: Use light weight to protect shoulders.
Avoid this exercise if you have shoulder impingement.

name: Dumbbell Prone Incline Curl
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie face down on incline bench, let arms hang down.
Hold dumbbells with palms facing forward.
Curl dumbbells up by bending elbows.
Lower slowly back to start.
common_mistakes: Using too much weight, causing back to arch.
injury_prevention_tips: Start light to avoid lower back strain.
Keep wrists neutral.

name: Dumbbell Tricep Extension - Pronated Grip
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on bench, hold dumbbells above shoulders, palms forward.
Lower dumbbells toward ears, keeping elbows in.
Extend arms to lift dumbbells back up.
Keep upper arms stationary.
common_mistakes: Moving upper arms during the rep.
injury_prevention_tips: Use lighter weight to protect elbows.
Avoid overextending elbows at the top.

name: Dynamic Chest Stretch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand with hands together, arms extended in front.
Quickly open arms out to sides, then back together.
Repeat in a fluid, clapping motion.
Increase speed gradually.
common_mistakes: Using too much force, risking shoulder strain.
injury_prevention_tips: Warm up before doing this stretch.
Stop if you feel any sharp pain.

name: EZ-Bar Curl
beginner_friendly_instructions: Hold EZ bar with palms facing up, hands shoulder-width.
Keep elbows close to torso.
Curl bar up toward shoulders, squeezing biceps.
Lower slowly back to start.
injury_prevention_tips: Use a weight you can control.
Keep wrists neutral to avoid strain.

name: EZ-Bar Skullcrusher
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on bench, hold EZ bar above shoulders, elbows in.
Lower bar toward forehead by bending elbows.
Extend arms to lift bar back up.
Keep upper arms stationary.
common_mistakes: Moving upper arms during the rep.
injury_prevention_tips: Use lighter weight to protect elbows.
Avoid hitting your forehead with the bar.

name: Elbow Circles
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand or sit, place hands on shoulders.
Make large circles with your elbows.
Breathe out as you start, in as you finish.
Reverse direction after a few reps.
common_mistakes: Moving too fast and losing control.
injury_prevention_tips: Warm up before stretching.
Stop if you feel any joint pain.

name: Elbow to Knee
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on back, hands behind head, right leg crossed over left knee.
Bring left elbow toward right knee by twisting torso.
Return to start and repeat.
Switch sides after set.
form_cues: Keep neck neutral, dont pull on head.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep movements controlled to protect spine.
Avoid if you have lower back pain.

name: Elbows Back
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand tall, place hands on lower back.
Point fingers down, elbows out.
Gently pull elbows back to touch.
Hold for a few seconds.
injury_prevention_tips: Move gently, dont force the stretch.
Stop if you feel shoulder pain.

name: Elevated Back Lunge
beginner_friendly_instructions: Place bar on upper back, step onto a low platform.
Step back with one leg, lowering knee toward floor.
Pause, then drive through front foot to stand.
Return to start and switch legs.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with bodyweight to master balance.
Use a spotter if lifting heavy.

name: Elevated Cable Rows
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on cable row machine with feet elevated on a platform.
Lean forward slightly, grab handle with arms extended.
Pull handle to abdomen, squeezing back.
Return slowly to start.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep core braced to protect spine.
Avoid pulling too far back, stressing shoulders.

name: Exercise Ball Crunch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on ball, walk feet out until lower back is on ball.
Hands behind head or across chest.
Curl shoulders up, contracting abs.
Lower back down with control.
common_mistakes: Rolling ball too far, losing balance.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep movements controlled.
Use a wall for support if needed.

name: Exercise Ball Pull-In
beginner_friendly_instructions: Start in push-up position with shins on ball.
Keep body straight, pull knees toward chest.
Roll ball forward with feet.
Extend legs back to start.
form_cues: Keep hips down, dont lift them.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep core tight to protect lower back.
Start with short range of motion.

name: Extended Range One-Arm Kettlebell Floor Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on floor, hold kettlebell in one hand.
Bend opposite knee and cross it over body.
Press kettlebell up, extending arm fully.
Lower until back touches floor, then press again.
form_cues: Press through the heel of the hand.
injury_prevention_tips: Use lighter weight to control the extended range.
Keep wrist neutral.

name: External Rotation
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on side, hold dumbbell in top hand, elbow bent 90.
Keep elbow tucked to side, forearm parallel to floor.
Rotate forearm up until dumbbell points to ceiling.
Lower slowly back down.
injury_prevention_tips: Use very light weight.
Stop if you feel shoulder impingement.

name: External Rotation with Band
beginner_friendly_instructions: Anchor band at elbow height, stand sideways.
Hold band with far hand, elbow at side, bent 90.
Rotate arm back, keeping elbow fixed.
Return slowly to start.
injury_prevention_tips: Use light band resistance.
Keep movements controlled.

name: External Rotation with Cable
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set cable at elbow height, stand sideways.
Hold handle with far hand, elbow at side, bent 90.
Rotate arm back, keeping elbow fixed.
Return slowly to start.
injury_prevention_tips: Use light weight.
Keep movements controlled.

name: Face Pull
beginner_friendly_instructions: Attach rope to high pulley, stand facing it.
Grab rope, pull toward face, separating hands.
Keep upper arms parallel to floor.
Return slowly to start.
common_mistakes: Pulling too low, targeting lats instead of rear delts.
Using too much weight, causing momentum.
injury_prevention_tips: Use moderate weight to maintain control.
Keep wrists neutral.

name: Finger Curls
beginner_friendly_instructions: Hold barbell with palms up, hands shoulder-width.
Let bar roll down to fingertips.
Curl fingers to roll bar back up.
Close hands fully at the top.
common_mistakes: Using arms to curl the bar.
injury_prevention_tips: Use light weight to avoid finger strain.
Keep wrists neutral.

name: Flat Bench Cable Flyes
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on flat bench between two low pulleys.
Hold handles with palms up, arms slightly bent.
Bring hands together in wide arc over chest.
Return slowly to start.
form_cues: Keep elbows slightly bent and fixed.
common_mistakes: Bending elbows more during the rep.
injury_prevention_tips: Use light weight to control the movement.
Avoid excessive range of motion if shoulders hurt.

name: Flat Bench Leg Pull-In
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on bench, legs off the end, hands under glutes or holding bench.
Pull knees toward chest by bending hips and knees.
Pause at the top.
Extend legs back to start.
form_cues: Keep lower back pressed into bench.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep movements controlled.
Avoid if you have lower back pain.

name: Flat Bench Lying Leg Raise
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on bench, legs extended off the end, hands under glutes.
Raise legs until perpendicular to floor.
Pause, then lower slowly.
Keep legs straight.
form_cues: Keep lower back pressed into bench.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep movements controlled.
Avoid if you have lower back pain.

name: Flexor Incline Dumbbell Curls
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on incline bench, hold dumbbells, arms hanging down.
Curl dumbbells up, keeping wrists back.
Squeeze biceps at the top.
Lower slowly back to start.
injury_prevention_tips: Use light weight to protect wrists.
Keep shoulders relaxed.

name: Floor Glute-Ham Raise
beginner_friendly_instructions: Kneel with partner holding feet or anchored under something.
Lower torso forward slowly, keeping hips extended.
Catch yourself with hands, then push back up.
Return to start.
form_cues: Keep body straight like a board.
Use hands lightly to assist up.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with partial range of motion.
Use a partner for safety.

name: Floor Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on floor, hold barbell above chest.
Lower bar until upper arms touch floor.
Pause, then press back up.
Keep elbows tucked.
injury_prevention_tips: Use a spotter if lifting heavy.
Keep core braced.

name: Floor Press with Chains
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on floor, hold barbell with chains draped over ends.
Lower bar until upper arms touch floor.
Press up, letting chains hang.
Pause, then repeat.
injury_prevention_tips: Secure chains properly.
Use a spotter if lifting heavy.

name: Flutter Kicks
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie face down on bench, hips on edge, arms holding bench.
Lift legs slightly off floor.
Alternate kicking legs up and down.
Keep legs straight.
common_mistakes: Using momentum instead of muscle control.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with short sets.
Keep core engaged to protect lower back.

name: Foot-SMR
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit with shoes off, place foot roller under arch.
Press down firmly and roll slowly.
Hold tender spots for 10-30 seconds.
Switch feet.
injury_prevention_tips: Avoid rolling over bony areas.
Stop if you feel sharp pain.

name: Freehand Jump Squat
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand with hands behind head, feet shoulder-width.
Squat down until thighs are parallel to floor.
Jump explosively straight up.
Land softly and immediately squat again.
form_cues: Keep chest up and back straight.
common_mistakes: Using arms to pull yourself up.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with small jumps to learn landing.
Avoid if you have knee pain.

name: Frog Hops
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand with hands behind head, squat down.
Jump forward a few feet.
Land softly and absorb impact.
Immediately jump again.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with short hops.
Use a soft surface if possible.

name: Frog Sit-Ups
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on back, soles of feet together, knees out.
Cross arms over chest.
Curl torso up, lifting shoulders off floor.
Lower back down slowly.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep movements controlled.
Avoid if you have lower back pain.

name: Front Barbell Squat
beginner_friendly_instructions: Rack barbell on shoulders, elbows high.
Stand with feet shoulder-width, toes slightly out.
Squat down until thighs are below parallel.
Drive up through heels to stand.
form_cues: Keep elbows high and chest up.
common_mistakes: Elbows dropping, causing bar to roll forward.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with light weight to master form.
Use a squat rack for safety.

name: Front Barbell Squat To A Bench
beginner_friendly_instructions: Rack barbell on shoulders, place bench behind you.
Squat down until glutes touch the bench.
Pause briefly, then stand up.
Keep chest up throughout.
form_cues: Control the descent to the bench.
injury_prevention_tips: Use a stable bench.
Start with light weight.

name: Front Cable Raise
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand facing away from low pulley, hold handle in one hand.
Arm extended down in front of thigh.
Raise arm forward to shoulder height.
Lower slowly back down.
common_mistakes: Using torso to swing the weight.
injury_prevention_tips: Use light weight.
Stop if you feel shoulder impingement.

name: Front Dumbbell Raise
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand holding dumbbells in front of thighs.
Raise one dumbbell forward to shoulder height.
Lower it as you raise the other.
Alternate arms.
common_mistakes: Using torso to swing the weight.
injury_prevention_tips: Use light weight.
Stop if you feel shoulder impingement.

name: Front Incline Dumbbell Raise
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set an incline bench to 30-45 degrees and sit back holding a light dumbbell in each hand.
Start with arms straight down, palms facing the floor, and a slight bend in your elbows.
Raise the dumbbells forward and up in a controlled arc until your arms are just above parallel to the floor.
Pause briefly at the top, then slowly lower back to the start.
form_cues: Lead with your thumbs to keep tension on the front delts.
Keep your head pressed firmly against the bench.
Imagine pouring water out of a pitcher at the top of the movement.
common_mistakes: Bending the elbows too much (turning it into a row).
Lifting too high, which shrugs the shoulder and reduces deltoid activation.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep a slight bend in the elbows to protect the joint.
Avoid going heavier than you can control with strict form.

name: Front Leg Raises
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand tall next to a sturdy object for balance.
Keep your standing leg slightly bent for stability.
Swing one leg straight forward and up as high as comfortable, then swing it back behind you.
Perform controlled reps, then switch legs.
form_cues: Keep your torso upright and still.
Move only at the hip joint.
Control the swing; dont let momentum take over.
common_mistakes: Leaning backward or forward as you swing.
Using momentum instead of muscular control.
Bouncing at the end range of motion.
injury_prevention_tips: Warm up the hips and hamstrings first.
Keep the movement smooth to avoid jerking the low back.

name: Front Plate Raise
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand tall holding a weight plate with hands at 3 and 9 oclock.
Keep arms almost straight with a soft elbow and plate in front of your thighs.
Raise the plate straight up in front of you to shoulder height.
Lower slowly back down without swinging.
form_cues: Keep your elbows almost locked throughout.
Squeeze your front delts at the top.
injury_prevention_tips: Use a light plate to master the movement first.
Avoid excessive leaning back.

name: Front Raise And Pullover
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on a flat bench holding a light barbell with a shoulder-width grip.
Start with the bar on your upper thighs, arms straight with soft elbows.
Raise the bar up and over your head in one smooth arc until arms are overhead.
Reverse the motion to return to the start.
form_cues: Keep a soft elbow bend to protect the joint.
Keep your core braced to protect your lower back.
common_mistakes: Flaring elbows wide during the pullover.
Using a straight-arm motion that stresses the elbow.
injury_prevention_tips: Use a light weight to avoid shoulder strain.
Keep your lower back gently pressed into the bench.

name: Front Squat (Clean Grip)
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set a barbell just below shoulder height in a rack.
Clean the bar to your shoulders, resting it on your front delts with elbows high.
Step out, set feet shoulder-width, toes slightly out.
Squat down by sitting between your legs, keeping chest up, then drive through heels to stand.
form_cues: Keep elbows high the entire set.
Drive knees out to match toes.
common_mistakes: Elbows dropping, causing the chest to collapse.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with a light weight or goblet squat to learn the pattern.
If wrist mobility limits your clean grip, use straps or cross-arm grip.

name: Front Squats With Two Kettlebells
beginner_friendly_instructions: Clean two kettlebells to the front of your shoulders, elbows high.
Set feet shoulder-width, toes slightly out.
Squat down between your legs, keeping chest tall and knees tracking over toes.
Drive through your heels to stand back up.
form_cues: Keep elbows high and close to your body.
Push knees out as you descend.
common_mistakes: Rounding the back at the bottom.
injury_prevention_tips: Use a light kettlebell to learn the movement.
Pause briefly at the bottom to ensure control.

name: Front Two-Dumbbell Raise
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand tall holding a dumbbell in each hand in front of your thighs, palms facing your legs.
Keep a slight bend in your elbows.
Raise both dumbbells straight in front of you to shoulder height.
Lower slowly back down without swinging.
form_cues: Keep elbows almost straight but not locked.
common_mistakes: Using momentum by swinging the weights.
injury_prevention_tips: Use lighter weights to maintain control.
Avoid arching your low back.

name: Full Range-Of-Motion Lat Pulldown
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit at a lat pulldown machine and grab handles with an overhand or neutral grip.
Keep your chest up and a slight arch in your lower back.
Pull the handles down in an arc, rotating your palms to face each other at the bottom.
Squeeze your lats, then slowly return to the start with control.
common_mistakes: Pulling with the arms instead of the lats.
Using momentum by jerking the bar down.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with a light weight to groove the path.
Keep your lower back neutral.

name: Gironda Sternum Chins
beginner_friendly_instructions: Grab a pull-up bar with an underhand grip, shoulder-width.
Hang with arms straight, chest up, and lean back slightly.
Pull yourself up while keeping your torso arched and head back, aiming your chest toward the bar.
Lower slowly with control.
form_cues: Keep your chest proud and elbows forward.
Pull your shoulder blades down before bending elbows.
Lead with your chest, not just your chin.
common_mistakes: Pulling with straight-up vertical form (hits arms more).
Dropping the chest during the pull.
injury_prevention_tips: If you cant pull to the bar, use bands or do negatives.
Avoid excessive lumbar arching; keep core engaged.

name: Glute Ham Raise
beginner_friendly_instructions: Adjust the GHD machine so your knees are just behind the pad.
Start upright with your body straight and feet secured.
Lower your torso slowly toward the floor by bending at the knees, keeping your body in a straight line.
Drive through your feet and use your hamstrings and glutes to return to upright.
form_cues: Keep your body in one straight line.
Control the descent with your hamstrings.
common_mistakes: Collapsing at the hips or rounding the back.
Starting too far forward and losing tension.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with partial range if youre new to the movement.
Keep your core braced throughout.

name: Glute Kickback
beginner_friendly_instructions: Get on all fours with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
Keep your right knee bent at 90 degrees.
Drive your right heel up and back until your thigh is parallel to the floor.
Squeeze your glute, then slowly return to the start and repeat.
form_cues: Keep your hips square to the floor.
Squeeze the glute at the top.
common_mistakes: Rotating the hips or lifting the leg to the side.
Using momentum instead of glute control.
injury_prevention_tips: Use a light ankle weight only after mastering form.
Keep your core engaged to stabilize the pelvis.

name: Goblet Squat
beginner_friendly_instructions: Hold a kettlebell by the horns at your chest.
Set feet slightly wider than shoulder-width, toes slightly out.
Squat down between your legs, keeping chest up and elbows inside knees.
Drive through your heels to stand back up.
form_cues: Push knees out with your elbows.
injury_prevention_tips: Use a light weight to learn the pattern.
Pause at the bottom to ensure control.

name: Good Morning
beginner_friendly_instructions: Place a barbell across your upper back (not on your neck).
Stand with feet hip-width, knees slightly bent.
Hinge at the hips, pushing them back while keeping your back flat and chest up.
Return to standing by driving hips forward and squeezing glutes.
form_cues: Push hips back like closing a car door with your butt.
common_mistakes: Bending knees too much (turning into a squat).
injury_prevention_tips: Start with an empty bar or very light load.
Keep your core braced like youre about to be punched.

name: Good Morning off Pins
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set safety pins just below hip height.
Bend over and set the bar on your upper back while bent over.
Stand up with the weight, then hinge at the hips to lower the bar back to the pins.
Keep your back flat and chest up throughout.
form_cues: Hinge at the hips, not the waist.
Control the descent to the pins.
common_mistakes: Rounding the back to reach the pins.
Jerking the bar off the pins.
injury_prevention_tips: Use a light weight until the pattern is solid.
Set pins high enough to avoid excessive range that compromises form.

name: Gorilla Chin/Crunch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Hang from a pull-up bar with an underhand grip.
Bend knees to 90 degrees with calves parallel to the floor.
Simultaneously pull your chin toward the bar and crunch your knees toward your chest.
Lower slowly back to the hang.
form_cues: Initiate with a lat pull before bending elbows.
Curl your pelvis toward your ribs at the top.
common_mistakes: Pulling only with arms and not engaging lats.
injury_prevention_tips: Use a neutral grip if you have wrist issues.
Avoid kipping to protect shoulders.

name: Groin and Back Stretch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on the floor with feet together and knees bent out.
Interlock fingers behind your head.
Gently curl your torso forward, bringing elbows toward the inside of your thighs.
Return upright and repeat.
form_cues: Keep your back rounded, not arched.
Keep feet together and knees out.
common_mistakes: Pulling on the head with your hands.
Arching the back instead of rounding.
injury_prevention_tips: Move slowly and avoid bouncing.
Stop if you feel sharp pain.

name: Groiners
beginner_friendly_instructions: Start in a push-up position.
Jump both feet forward to land just outside your hands.
Keep your chest up and hips low.
Jump back to the start and repeat.
form_cues: Land softly with your whole foot.
common_mistakes: Landing with your knees caving inward.
Letting your hips rise too high.
Using only your calves to jump.
injury_prevention_tips: Go slow at first to learn control.
Avoid if you have knee pain; regress to lateral lunges.

name: Hack Squat
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set your back against the hack squat pad and shoulders under pads.
Place feet shoulder-width, toes slightly out.
Unrack and lower until thighs are below parallel, keeping knees tracking over toes.
Drive through your mid-foot to stand back up.
form_cues: Keep your chest up and back pressed into the pad.
Push knees out to match toes.
Drive through the mid-foot, not toes.
injury_prevention_tips: Use safety stops and set them to a safe depth.
Start light to dial in knee tracking.

name: Hammer Curl
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand tall holding dumbbells at your sides with palms facing your body.
Keep elbows tucked in and curl the weights up to shoulder height.
Squeeze biceps at the top, then lower slowly.
Keep wrists neutral throughout.
form_cues: Keep elbows pinned to your sides.
common_mistakes: Moving elbows forward as you curl.
Using wrist flexion instead of elbow flexion.
injury_prevention_tips: Choose a weight you can control for all reps.
Avoid excessive leaning back.

name: Hammer Grip Incline DB Bench Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set an incline bench to 30-45 degrees.
Hold dumbbells at shoulder height with palms facing each other.
Press the weights up until arms are extended, keeping the neutral grip.
Lower slowly to the start position.
form_cues: Keep elbows slightly flared, not tucked or too wide.
Press through the chest, not just the arms.
common_mistakes: Pressing with triceps more than chest.
Bouncing the weights off the chest.
injury_prevention_tips: Use a controlled descent to protect shoulders.
Set safeties or have a spotter if going heavy.

name: Hamstring-SMR
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit with legs extended over a foam roller under your thighs.
Place hands behind you for support and lift hips.
Shift weight to one leg and roll from below the hip to above the knee.
Pause on tender spots for 10-30 seconds, then switch sides.
common_mistakes: Rolling directly over the knee joint.
injury_prevention_tips: Avoid rolling over bone or joints.
Dont spend too long on one spot to avoid bruising.

name: Hamstring Stretch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on your back with one leg extended up, the other flat.
Loop a band or towel around the foot of the raised leg.
Gently pull the band to increase the stretch in the back of the thigh.
Hold, then switch legs.
form_cues: Keep the raised leg slightly bent if needed.
Keep your lower back on the floor.
common_mistakes: Pulling too hard and causing pain.
Lifting the opposite hip off the floor.
injury_prevention_tips: Ease into the stretch gradually.
Stop if you feel sharp pain or numbness.

name: Handstand Push-Ups
beginner_friendly_instructions: Face a wall and place hands shoulder-width apart.
Kick up carefully so your feet rest against the wall and your body is vertical.
Lower your head toward the floor with control, keeping elbows tracking out.
Press back up to the starting position.
form_cues: Keep your body straight and tight.
Look at the wall, not the floor.
Control the descent to protect your head.
injury_prevention_tips: Use parallettes or blocks to increase clearance.
Have a spotter or practice negatives first.

name: Hanging Bar Good Morning
beginner_friendly_instructions: Suspend a barbell from chains or straps at hip height.
Bend over and set the bar across your upper back.
With a flat back and soft knees, hinge at the hips to lower your torso.
Drive hips forward to return to standing.
injury_prevention_tips: Start very light or with just the bar.
Keep core braced throughout.

name: Hanging Leg Raise
beginner_friendly_instructions: Hang from a pull-up bar with arms straight.
Keep legs straight and lift them until they are parallel to the floor or higher.
Pause at the top, then lower slowly.
Avoid swinging.
form_cues: Start by tilting your pelvis back.
Lift with your lower abs, not momentum.
Keep arms straight and shoulders engaged.
common_mistakes: Using momentum to swing the legs.
injury_prevention_tips: If you feel shoulder pain, regress to knee raises.
Keep a slight bend in the elbows if needed.

name: Hanging Pike
beginner_friendly_instructions: Hang from a pull-up bar with an overhand grip.
Bend knees to 90 degrees and lift legs forward.
Pull your knees toward your chest while keeping legs bent.
Lower slowly without swinging.
form_cues: Initiate by tilting the pelvis back.
injury_prevention_tips: Use wrist wraps if grip is limiting.
Avoid if you have shoulder impingement; regress to knee raises.

name: High Cable Curls
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set cable pulleys above shoulder height.
Stand between them and grab handles with palms facing up.
Curl handles toward your ears, keeping elbows in place.
Lower slowly to the start.
form_cues: Keep elbows fixed and in front of the body.
injury_prevention_tips: Use a weight that allows full control.
Avoid excessive leaning back.

name: Hip Circles (prone)
beginner_friendly_instructions: Start on hands and knees.
Lift one knee off the floor and keep it bent at 90 degrees.
Make large circles with your knee, moving from the hip joint.
Complete reps on one side, then switch.
form_cues: Move only at the hip, not the lower back.
Keep the movement smooth and controlled.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep the range comfortable.
Avoid if you feel pinching in the hip.

name: Hip Extension with Bands
beginner_friendly_instructions: Anchor a band low and attach it to your ankle.
Face the anchor and hold onto something for balance.
Keeping your leg straight, push your hip back and extend the leg behind you.
Return to the start with control.
form_cues: Keep your chest up and hips square.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with a light band.
Keep core engaged to protect the spine.

name: Hip Flexion with Band
beginner_friendly_instructions: Anchor a band low behind you and attach to your ankle.
Face away from the anchor and hold for balance.
Lift your knee up to about 90 degrees, keeping the torso tall.
Lower slowly back down.
form_cues: Avoid leaning back as you lift.
common_mistakes: Using momentum to swing the leg up.
injury_prevention_tips: Use a light band.
Stop if you feel low back strain.

name: Hip Lift with Band
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on your back with a band looped over your hips and anchored on both sides.
Bend knees and place feet flat on the floor.
Drive through heels to lift hips into a bridge, pressing into the band.
Pause at the top, then lower slowly.
injury_prevention_tips: Ensure the band is secure.
Keep your chin slightly tucked to protect the neck.

name: Hug A Ball
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on the floor and straddle a large exercise ball.
Lower your hips toward the floor and hug the ball with both arms.
Keep feet flat and knees over ankles.
Hold the stretch comfortably.
form_cues: Breathe into your back and sides.
Keep the ball secure with your arms.
injury_prevention_tips: Use a stable surface so the ball doesnt slip.
Avoid if you feel sharp pain in the spine.

name: Hug Knees To Chest
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on your back.
Pull both knees toward your chest and hug them under your knees (not over).
Gently pull your knees toward your shoulders to increase the stretch.
Hold and breathe.
form_cues: Keep your head on the floor.
common_mistakes: Pulling over the knees (adds knee pressure).
injury_prevention_tips: Move gently and avoid jerking.
Stop if you feel knee pain.

name: Hyperextensions (Back Extensions)
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie face down on a hyperextension bench with ankles secured.
Cross arms over chest or hold a plate lightly.
Hinge at the hips to lower your torso, keeping a neutral spine.
Raise back up using glutes and lower back, stopping at a straight line.
form_cues: Move through the hips, not the low back.
common_mistakes: Rounding the back on the way down.
injury_prevention_tips: Avoid going too deep if you feel pinching.
Keep your neck neutral; dont crane it.

name: Hyperextensions With No Hyperextension Bench
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on a bench with your hips off the edge and have a partner hold your ankles.
Cross arms over chest or hold a plate lightly.
Hinge at the hips to lower your torso, keeping a neutral spine.
Raise back up using glutes and lower back.
injury_prevention_tips: Dont lower too far; stop when you feel a stretch, not pain.
Ensure your partner has a secure grip.

name: IT Band and Glute Stretch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on your back and loop a band around one foot.
Cross that leg over your body toward the opposite side.
Keep the leg straight and pull the band to flex the foot.
Hold, then switch sides.
form_cues: Breathe and relax into the stretch.
injury_prevention_tips: Ease into the stretch gradually.
Stop if you feel knee or hip pain.

name: Iliotibial Tract-SMR
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on your side with a foam roller under the outer thigh.
Cross the top leg over and place weight on the bottom leg.
Roll from hip to knee, pausing on tender spots.
Switch sides.
injury_prevention_tips: Avoid excessive time on one spot.
Dont roll over bony areas.

name: Inchworm
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand tall with feet together.
Bend at the hips and place hands on the floor.
Walk hands forward until youre in a plank position.
Walk feet toward hands, keeping legs straight, then stand.
form_cues: Keep legs as straight as possible.
Keep core engaged in the plank.
common_mistakes: Bending knees too much when walking feet in.
injury_prevention_tips: If hamstrings are tight, bend knees slightly.
Avoid if you have wrist pain; use fists or parallettes.

name: Incline Barbell Triceps Extension
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set an incline bench to 45-60 degrees and lie back.
Hold a barbell with a close overhand grip and extend arms overhead.
Lower the bar behind your head by bending only at the elbows.
Extend back up, keeping elbows in.
form_cues: Keep elbows tucked and pointing forward.
common_mistakes: Using too much weight and compromising shoulder position.
injury_prevention_tips: Start light to protect elbows and shoulders.
Avoid excessive range if you feel shoulder strain.

name: Incline Bench Pull
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set an incline bench to about 30 degrees and lie face down.
Hold light dumbbells with palms down, arms hanging straight.
Pull dumbbells up by bending elbows and driving them back.
Squeeze shoulder blades at the top, then lower slowly.
form_cues: Keep your chest on the bench.
common_mistakes: Lifting your chest off the bench.
injury_prevention_tips: Use light weights to avoid shoulder strain.
Keep neck neutral.

name: Incline Cable Chest Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set an incline bench between two low-to-high cable pulleys.
Sit back and grab handles, elbows bent and slightly flared.
Press handles forward and up until arms are extended.
Return slowly with control.
form_cues: Press in an arc, not straight forward.
common_mistakes: Using too much weight and losing control.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with light weight.
Keep your core braced to protect the lower back.

name: Incline Cable Flye
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set an incline bench to about 45 degrees between two low pulleys.
Lie back and grab handles, start with hands together above your chest.
Lower arms in a wide arc with soft elbows until you feel a stretch.
Bring hands back together, squeezing your chest.
form_cues: Keep a slight bend in elbows.
Move only at the shoulder joint.
common_mistakes: Using too much weight and flaring elbows.
Moving at the elbows instead of shoulders.
injury_prevention_tips: Use light weight to protect shoulders.
Avoid going too low if you feel shoulder strain.

name: Incline Dumbbell Bench With Palms Facing In
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set an incline bench to 30-45 degrees.
Hold dumbbells at shoulder height with palms facing each other.
Press up until arms are extended, keeping the neutral grip.
Lower slowly to the start.
injury_prevention_tips: Use a controlled descent.
Set safeties if going heavy.

name: Incline Dumbbell Curl
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set an incline bench to about 45 degrees and sit back.
Hold dumbbells at your sides with palms facing forward.
Curl the weights up, keeping elbows pinned to your sides.
Lower slowly with control.
injury_prevention_tips: Use a weight you can control for all reps.
Avoid leaning back excessively.

name: Incline Dumbbell Flyes
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set an incline bench to 30 degrees and lie back.
Hold dumbbells above your chest with a slight elbow bend.
Lower arms out to the sides in a wide arc until you feel a stretch.
Bring dumbbells back up, squeezing your chest.
form_cues: Keep a slight bend in elbows.
Move only at the shoulder joint.
common_mistakes: Lowering too low and stressing shoulders.
injury_prevention_tips: Use light weight to protect shoulders.
Avoid excessive range if you feel strain.

name: Incline Dumbbell Flyes - With A Twist
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set an incline bench to 30 degrees and lie back.
Start with dumbbells above chest, palms facing each other.
As you lower, rotate wrists so palms face the ceiling.
Reverse the rotation as you press back up.
form_cues: Keep a slight bend in elbows.
Move only at the shoulder and wrist.
Keep the arc wide and controlled.
common_mistakes: Twisting too aggressively and losing control.
injury_prevention_tips: Use light weight.
Avoid going too low if you feel shoulder strain.

name: Incline Dumbbell Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set an incline bench to 30-45 degrees.
Hold dumbbells at shoulder height with palms facing forward.
Press up until arms are extended.
Lower slowly to the start.
form_cues: Keep elbows slightly flared, not tucked.
injury_prevention_tips: Use a controlled descent.
Set safeties or have a spotter if going heavy.

name: Incline Hammer Curl
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set an incline bench to about 45 degrees and sit back.
Hold dumbbells at your sides with palms facing each other.
Curl the weights up, keeping elbows pinned and wrists neutral.
Lower slowly with control.
form_cues: Squeeze biceps and brachialis at the top.
injury_prevention_tips: Use a weight you can control.
Avoid leaning back excessively.

name: Incline Inner Biceps Curl
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set an incline bench to about 45 degrees and sit back.
Hold dumbbells at your sides with palms facing forward.
Curl the weights outward and up, keeping elbows close to your sides.
Lower slowly with control.
form_cues: Keep elbows pinned to your sides.
Curl outward to emphasize inner biceps.
injury_prevention_tips: Use light weight to master the path.
Avoid leaning back.

name: Incline Push-Up
beginner_friendly_instructions: Place hands on a bench or sturdy platform, slightly wider than shoulder-width.
Walk feet back until your body forms a straight line.
Lower your chest to the bench by bending elbows.
Press back up until arms are extended.
form_cues: Keep your body in a straight line.
injury_prevention_tips: Use a higher surface if youre new or have wrist issues.
Keep wrists neutral; use fists if needed.

name: Incline Push-Up Close-Grip
beginner_friendly_instructions: Place hands on an elevated surface (like a bench or bar) directly next to each other.
Walk your feet back until your body forms a straight line from head to heels.
Lower your chest toward the surface by bending your elbows, keeping them tucked.
Press back up to the starting position.
form_cues: Keep your core tightno sagging hips.
Elbows should point slightly back, not flare out.
Control the descent; don't just drop.
common_mistakes: Letting hips sag or pike up.
Flaring elbows out to the sides.
Moving too fast and losing tension.
injury_prevention_tips: If you feel shoulder pain, widen your hand placement slightly or elevate your hands higher.
Keep wrists neutraldon't let them bend backward.

name: Incline Push-Up Medium
beginner_friendly_instructions: Place hands on an elevated surface, shoulder-width apart.
Step feet back to form a straight body line.
Lower your chest to the surface by bending elbows.
Press back up to full arm extension.
form_cues: Keep your neck neutrallook slightly ahead, not down.
Squeeze your glutes to stabilize your lower body.
Drive through your palms, not your fingers.
common_mistakes: Bouncing at the bottom of the movement.
Letting elbows flare out too wide.
injury_prevention_tips: If wrists hurt, use push-up handles or dumbbells for a neutral grip.
Ensure the surface is stable and won't slip.

name: Incline Push-Up Reverse Grip
beginner_friendly_instructions: Place hands on an elevated surface with palms facing up (reverse grip).
Walk feet back to create a straight body line.
Lower your chest toward the surface by bending elbows.
Press back up, maintaining the reverse grip.
form_cues: Keep elbows close to your body.
Focus on squeezing the chest at the top.
injury_prevention_tips: Use a secure surface to prevent slipping.
If you feel wrist strain, switch to a neutral grip or standard push-up.

name: Incline Push-Up Wide
beginner_friendly_instructions: Place hands on an elevated surface wider than shoulder-width.
Step feet back to form a straight body line.
Lower your chest to the surface by bending elbows.
Press back up to full extension.
form_cues: Keep elbows slightly flared but not excessive.
Maintain a neutral spineno arching or rounding.
common_mistakes: Hands too wide, causing shoulder strain.
Sagging hips or overarching lower back.
injury_prevention_tips: If shoulders feel strained, narrow your grip.
Ensure the surface is stable and won't shift.

name: Intermediate Groin Stretch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on your back with legs extended.
Loop a strap or band around one foot.
Gently pull the leg out to the side until you feel a stretch.
Hold for 10-20 seconds, then switch sides.
form_cues: Keep your hips flat on the floor.
Breathe deeply and relax into the stretch.
Avoid forcing the leg too far.
common_mistakes: Lifting the opposite hip off the ground.
injury_prevention_tips: Warm up before stretching to avoid strains.
If you feel sharp pain, ease off immediately.

name: Intermediate Hip Flexor and Quad Stretch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie face down on the floor.
Loop a strap or band around one foot.
Pull the foot toward your glute, keeping your hip pressed down.
Hold for 10-20 seconds, then switch sides.
form_cues: Keep your hips pressed into the floor.
Engage your glutes to deepen the stretch.
common_mistakes: Letting the hip lift off the ground.
Pulling too hard, causing knee discomfort.
injury_prevention_tips: If knee pain occurs, reduce the pull.
Use a soft surface for comfort.

name: Internal Rotation with Band
beginner_friendly_instructions: Anchor a resistance band at elbow height.
Stand sideways to the anchor, elbow bent at 90 and tucked into your side.
Rotate your forearm inward against the band's resistance.
Slowly return to the start and repeat.
form_cues: Keep your elbow glued to your side.
Move only at the shoulder joint.
common_mistakes: Moving the elbow away from the body.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with light resistance to avoid shoulder strain.
If you feel pinching, adjust your elbow position.

name: Inverted Row
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set a bar at waist height in a rack.
Grip the bar wider than shoulder-width and hang underneath.
Pull your chest toward the bar by bending elbows.
Lower yourself back down with control.
form_cues: Keep your body in a straight line.
Squeeze your shoulder blades at the top.
common_mistakes: Pulling with arms only, not engaging the back.
injury_prevention_tips: Ensure the bar is secure before starting.
If you can't maintain a straight line, elevate your feet.

name: Inverted Row with Straps
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set up suspension straps at an appropriate height.
Grip the handles and lean back with arms extended.
Pull your chest toward your hands by bending elbows.
Lower yourself back down with control.
form_cues: Keep your body straight from head to heels.
Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the top.
common_mistakes: Pulling too high, causing shoulder strain.
injury_prevention_tips: Adjust strap length to match your strength level.
If you feel shoulder pain, reduce the range of motion.

name: Iron Cross
beginner_friendly_instructions: Hold dumbbells at your sides with palms facing in.
Raise both arms out to the sides until they reach shoulder height.
Pause briefly, then lower slowly.
Repeat for the desired reps.
form_cues: Keep a slight bend in the elbows.
Lead with your elbows, not your hands.
common_mistakes: Using momentum to swing the weights.
Raising arms too high, causing shoulder impingement.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with light weights to master the form.
If you feel shoulder pain, reduce the range of motion.

name: Iron Crosses (stretch)
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie face down with arms extended out to the sides.
Bend one knee and bring it across your body toward the opposite hand.
Return to the start and switch legs.
Continue alternating for the desired reps.
form_cues: Keep your hips pressed into the floor.
common_mistakes: Lifting your hips off the ground.
injury_prevention_tips: If you feel knee pain, reduce the range of motion.
Warm up before performing this stretch.

name: Isometric Neck Exercise - Front And Back
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit or stand with a neutral head position.
Place both hands on your forehead and gently push forward while resisting with your neck.
Hold for 5-10 seconds, then relax.
Repeat with hands on the back of your head, pushing backward.
form_cues: Keep your neck aligned with your spine.
Engage the neck muscles without straining.
common_mistakes: Pushing too hard, causing neck strain.
Moving the head instead of resisting movement.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with very light pressure.
If you feel pain, stop immediately.

name: Isometric Neck Exercise - Sides
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit or stand with a neutral head position.
Place one hand on the side of your head and gently push while resisting with your neck.
Hold for 5-10 seconds, then relax.
Switch sides and repeat.
form_cues: Keep your neck aligned with your spine.
Engage the neck muscles without straining.
common_mistakes: Pushing too hard, causing neck strain.
Moving the head instead of resisting movement.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with very light pressure.
If you feel pain, stop immediately.

name: Isometric Wipers
beginner_friendly_instructions: Start in a push-up position with hands slightly outside shoulder-width.
Shift your body weight to one side, allowing that elbow to bend.
Push back to the center and shift to the other side.
Continue alternating for the desired reps.
form_cues: Keep your body in a straight line.
common_mistakes: Moving too quickly and losing control.
Bending the supporting arm too much.
injury_prevention_tips: If you can't maintain a straight line, elevate your hands.
Stop if you feel shoulder pain.

name: JM Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on a flat bench with a barbell.
Grip the bar close to your shoulders.
Lower the bar toward your upper chest, letting it roll back slightly.
Press the bar back up using your triceps.
common_mistakes: Letting the bar roll too far back.
Using too much weight, causing form breakdown.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with light weights to master the movement.
If you feel elbow pain, switch to a different triceps exercise.

name: Jackknife Sit-Up
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on your back with arms and legs extended.
Simultaneously lift your legs and torso, reaching your hands toward your feet.
Pause at the top, then lower back down.
Repeat for the desired reps.
form_cues: Keep your legs as straight as possible.
injury_prevention_tips: If you feel lower back pain, reduce the range of motion.
Place a mat under your back for comfort.

name: Janda Sit-Up
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat.
Squeeze your glutes and hamstrings tightly.
Slowly sit up, keeping the tension in your glutes.
Lower yourself back down with control.
form_cues: Move slowly to avoid using momentum.
injury_prevention_tips: If you feel lower back pain, reduce the range of motion.
Start with partial reps if needed.

name: Jefferson Squats
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand straddling a barbell on the floor.
Grip the bar with one hand in front and one behind you.
Stand up by driving through your legs.
Lower back down with control.
form_cues: Keep your back straight and chest up.
Let your arms hang, don't pull with them.
common_mistakes: Letting the bar drift away from your body.
Using your arms to lift the weight.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with light weights to master the setup.
Keep your core braced throughout.

name: Kettlebell Arnold Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Hold a kettlebell at shoulder height with palm facing in.
Press the weight overhead while rotating your palm to face forward.
Lower back down, rotating the palm back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired reps.
common_mistakes: Using too much weight, causing form breakdown.
Letting the kettlebell drift too far forward.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with light weights to master the rotation.
If you feel shoulder pain, reduce the range of motion.

name: Kettlebell Dead Clean
beginner_friendly_instructions: Place a kettlebell between your feet.
Hinge at the hips and grip the kettlebell.
Drive through your legs and hips to pull the kettlebell to shoulder height.
Lower it back down with control.
form_cues: Use your hips, not your arms, to lift.
Catch the kettlebell softly at the shoulder.
common_mistakes: Pulling with your arms instead of hips.
Letting the kettlebell flop onto your forearm.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with light weights to master the technique.
If you feel lower back pain, reduce the weight.

name: Kettlebell Figure 8
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand with a wide stance and a kettlebell between your feet.
Hinge at the hips and grab the kettlebell with one hand.
Pass it between your legs to the other hand.
Continue passing back and forth for the desired reps.
form_cues: Move smoothly and control the kettlebell.
common_mistakes: Letting the kettlebell hit your legs.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with a light kettlebell.
Wear long pants to avoid scrapes.

name: Kettlebell Hang Clean
beginner_friendly_instructions: Hold a kettlebell in front of you with both hands.
Hinge at the hips and let the kettlebell hang.
Drive through your legs and hips to pull the kettlebell to shoulder height.
Lower it back down with control.
form_cues: Use your hips, not your arms, to lift.
Catch the kettlebell softly at the shoulder.
common_mistakes: Pulling with your arms instead of hips.
Letting the kettlebell flop onto your forearm.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with light weights to master the technique.
If you feel lower back pain, reduce the weight.

name: Kettlebell One-Legged Deadlift
beginner_friendly_instructions: Hold a kettlebell in one hand.
Stand on one leg, keeping a slight bend in the knee.
Hinge at the hips, lowering the kettlebell toward the ground.
Return to the starting position by driving your hips forward.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with a light kettlebell.
Use a wall or pole for balance if needed.

name: Kettlebell Pass Between The Legs
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand with a wide stance and a kettlebell between your feet.
Hinge at the hips and grab the kettlebell with one hand.
Pass it between your legs to the other hand behind you.
Continue passing back and forth for the desired reps.
form_cues: Move smoothly and control the kettlebell.
common_mistakes: Letting the kettlebell hit your legs.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with a light kettlebell.
Wear long pants to avoid scrapes.

name: Kettlebell Pirate Ships
beginner_friendly_instructions: Hold a kettlebell with both hands in front of you.
Swing the kettlebell to one side at head height.
Let it drop and swing to the other side.
Continue alternating for the desired reps.
form_cues: Keep your arms extended but not locked.
Use your hips to generate momentum.
common_mistakes: Using only your arms to move the weight.
Letting the kettlebell pull you off balance.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with a light kettlebell.
Ensure you have enough space around you.

name: Kettlebell Pistol Squat
beginner_friendly_instructions: Hold a kettlebell in front of you with both hands.
Lift one leg off the ground.
Squat down on the standing leg, keeping your chest up.
Drive back up through your heel.
form_cues: Go as low as your mobility allows.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with bodyweight only.
Use a box or bench to limit the range of motion if needed.

name: Kettlebell Seated Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on the floor with legs extended.
Clean a kettlebell to one shoulder.
Press the kettlebell overhead until your arm is locked out.
Lower it back down to the shoulder.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with light weights.
If you feel lower back pain, reduce the weight.

name: Kettlebell Seesaw Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Clean two kettlebells to your shoulders.
Press one kettlebell overhead.
Lower it and immediately press the other.
Continue alternating for the desired reps.
form_cues: Press one arm at a time.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with light weights.
If you feel shoulder pain, reduce the weight.

name: Kettlebell Sumo High Pull
beginner_friendly_instructions: Place a kettlebell between your feet.
Adopt a wide stance and grip the kettlebell with both hands.
Drive through your legs and hips, pulling the kettlebell to shoulder height.
Lower it back down with control.
form_cues: Use your hips to generate power.
common_mistakes: Letting the kettlebell drift too far forward.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with light weights.
If you feel lower back pain, reduce the weight.

name: Kettlebell Thruster
beginner_friendly_instructions: Clean two kettlebells to your shoulders.
Perform a squat, keeping your chest up.
As you stand, press the kettlebells overhead.
Lower them back to your shoulders and repeat.
form_cues: Keep your chest up during the squat.
Use momentum from the squat to assist the press.
common_mistakes: Using only your arms to press.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with light weights.
If you feel knee pain, reduce the depth of the squat.

name: Kettlebell Turkish Get-Up (Lunge style)
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on your back with a kettlebell pressed overhead.
Roll to your side and push up to a seated position.
Lunge up to a standing position.
Reverse the steps to return to the start.
form_cues: Keep your eyes on the kettlebell.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with no weight to master the movement.
Use a light kettlebell when adding weight.

name: Kettlebell Turkish Get-Up (Squat style)
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on your back with a kettlebell pressed overhead.
Roll to your side and push up to a seated position.
Squat up to a standing position.
Reverse the steps to return to the start.
form_cues: Keep your eyes on the kettlebell.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with no weight to master the movement.
Use a light kettlebell when adding weight.

name: Kettlebell Windmill
beginner_friendly_instructions: Press a kettlebell overhead with one arm.
Push your hips back and to the side of the lifted kettlebell.
Lower your free hand toward the floor while keeping your eyes on the kettlebell.
Return to the starting position.
form_cues: Keep your eyes on the kettlebell.
Keep the pressing arm locked out.
Move slowly and control the descent.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with light weights.
Ensure you have adequate shoulder mobility.

name: Kipping Muscle Up
beginner_friendly_instructions: Grip rings or a pull-up bar with a false grip.
Swing your legs back, then forward and up.
As you swing up, pull your chest toward the bar and transition to a dip.
Push yourself up to full extension.
form_cues: Use your hips to generate momentum.
Transition smoothly from pull to push.
common_mistakes: Banging your chest against the bar.
injury_prevention_tips: Master strict pull-ups and dips first.
Use resistance bands to assist the movement if needed.

name: Knee Across The Body
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on your back with one leg straight.
Bend the other knee and cross it over your body.
Use your hand to gently pull the knee toward the floor.
Hold for 10-20 seconds, then switch sides.
form_cues: Keep your shoulders flat on the floor.
Breathe deeply and relax into the stretch.
Keep your head turned away from the knee.
common_mistakes: Lifting your shoulders off the floor.
injury_prevention_tips: Warm up before stretching.
If you feel sharp pain, ease off immediately.

name: Knee Circles
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand with feet together.
Bend your knees slightly and move them in a circular motion.
Continue for the desired number of circles.
Reverse direction if desired.
injury_prevention_tips: If you feel knee pain, reduce the range of motion.
Warm up before performing.

name: Knee/Hip Raise On Parallel Bars
beginner_friendly_instructions: Support yourself on parallel bars with your forearms on pads.
Keep your legs straight and hanging down.
Lift your legs until they are parallel to the floor.
Lower them back down with control.
common_mistakes: Using momentum to swing your legs.
injury_prevention_tips: If you feel lower back pain, reduce the range of motion.
Ensure the pads are secure.

name: Kneeling Cable Crunch With Alternating Oblique Twists
beginner_friendly_instructions: Attach a rope to a high pulley and kneel facing the machine.
Hold the rope by your ears and crunch down.
At the bottom, twist to one side, then the other.
Return to the top and repeat.
form_cues: Move from your ribs, not your arms.
common_mistakes: Moving your hips back and forth.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with light weight.
If you feel lower back pain, reduce the weight.

name: Kneeling Cable Triceps Extension
beginner_friendly_instructions: Attach a straight bar to a high pulley.
Kneel facing away from the machine, holding the bar overhead.
Extend your arms to press the bar forward.
Return to the starting position with control.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with light weight.
If you feel elbow pain, switch to a different exercise.

name: Kneeling Forearm Stretch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Kneel on the floor with your hands flat, fingers pointing back.
Gently lean back until you feel a stretch in your forearms.
Hold for 20-30 seconds.
Release and repeat if needed.
form_cues: Keep your palms flat on the floor.
common_mistakes: Lifting your palms off the floor.
Leaning too far back, causing pain.
injury_prevention_tips: If you feel sharp pain, ease off immediately.
Use a soft surface for your knees.

name: Kneeling High Pulley Row
beginner_friendly_instructions: Attach a rope to a high pulley and kneel a few feet away.
Hold the rope with arms extended.
Pull the rope toward your upper chest, squeezing your shoulder blades.
Return to the starting position with control.
form_cues: Pull with your elbows, not your arms.
Squeeze your back at the top.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with light weight.
If you feel lower back pain, reduce the weight.

name: Kneeling Hip Flexor
beginner_friendly_instructions: Kneel on one knee with the other foot flat in front.
Shift your weight forward until you feel a stretch in your hip.
Hold for 15-20 seconds.
Switch sides and repeat.
injury_prevention_tips: Use a soft surface for your knees.
If you feel knee pain, add padding.

name: Kneeling Single-Arm High Pulley Row
beginner_friendly_instructions: Attach a single handle to a high pulley and kneel.
Grip the handle with one hand, arm extended.
Pull the handle toward your torso, squeezing your shoulder blade.
Return to the starting position with control.
form_cues: Pull with your elbow, not your arm.
Squeeze your back at the end.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with light weight.
If you feel lower back pain, reduce the weight.

name: Kneeling Squat
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set a barbell on your back while kneeling.
Sit back with your hips until you touch your calves.
Drive forward to return to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired reps.
injury_prevention_tips: Use a padded mat for your knees.
Start with light weights.

name: Landmine 180's
beginner_friendly_instructions: Load a barbell into a landmine or corner.
Hold the end of the bar with both hands at shoulder height.
Rotate your torso and swing the bar down to one side, then up to the other.
Continue alternating for the desired reps.
form_cues: Rotate from your hips and torso.
common_mistakes: Using only your arms to move the weight.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with light weight.
If you feel lower back pain, reduce the weight.

name: Landmine Linear Jammer
beginner_friendly_instructions: Load a barbell into a landmine and attach a handle.
Start in an athletic stance with the handle at your shoulder.
Squat down slightly, then explosively drive up and press the handle forward.
Return to the starting position with control.
form_cues: Use your legs and hips to generate power.
common_mistakes: Locking your knees at the top.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with light weight.
If you feel knee pain, reduce the depth of the squat.

name: Lateral Raise - With Bands
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand on the middle of a resistance band.
Hold the handles with palms facing your thighs.
Raise your arms out to the sides until they reach shoulder height.
Lower them back down with control.
form_cues: Keep a slight bend in your elbows.
common_mistakes: Using momentum to swing the arms.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with light resistance.
If you feel shoulder pain, reduce the range of motion.

name: Latissimus Dorsi-SMR
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on your side with a foam roller under your armpit area.
Roll up and down your lats, stopping at tender spots.
Hold on tender spots for 20-30 seconds.
Switch sides and repeat.
form_cues: Keep your arm out of the way.
injury_prevention_tips: Avoid rolling over bone.
If you feel sharp pain, stop immediately.

name: Leg-Over Floor Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on your back with one kettlebell on your chest.
Cross one leg over the other.
Press the kettlebell straight up.
Lower it back down until your elbow touches the floor.
common_mistakes: Letting the kettlebell drift too far forward.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with light weight.
If you feel shoulder pain, reduce the weight.

name: Leg-Up Hamstring Stretch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on your back with one knee bent and foot flat.
Lift the other leg straight up.
Gently pull the leg toward your head until you feel a stretch.
Hold for 20-30 seconds, then switch sides.
form_cues: Keep your lower back flat on the floor.
