injury_prevention_tips: Stop the lift when your body forms a straight line.
Keep core braced to protect the lumbar spine.

name: Reverse Machine Flyes
beginner_friendly_instructions: Adjust seat so handles are at shoulder height. Sit facing the machine.
Grab handles with a neutral grip (palms in).
Push handles back and out, squeezing shoulder blades together.
Return slowly to the start.
form_cues: Keep a slight bend in elbows.
common_mistakes: Pushing too far back, causing shoulder strain.
injury_prevention_tips: Set a weight that allows a full range without pinching.
Keep wrists neutral.

name: Reverse Plate Curls
beginner_friendly_instructions: Hold a weight plate with both hands at the top, thumbs on one side, fingers on the other.
Stand tall, plate near your groin, arms straight down.
Curl the plate up by bending elbows, keeping elbows tucked.
Squeeze biceps at the top, then lower slowly.
injury_prevention_tips: Use a manageable weight to keep control.
Keep wrists neutral to avoid strain.

name: Reverse Triceps Bench Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on a flat bench with a barbell. Use a close underhand grip (palms up).
Unrack the bar and hold it over your chest, arms extended.
Lower the bar to your mid-chest, keeping elbows tucked.
Press up using triceps, lock out at the top.
common_mistakes: Bouncing the bar off the chest.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep wrists neutral to avoid strain.
Use a spotter for safety.

name: Rhomboids-SMR
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on the floor and place a foam roller under your upper back.
Cross arms over your chest or place hands behind head.
Lift hips off the ground and roll slowly up and down your upper back.
Pause on tender spots for 20-30 seconds.
common_mistakes: Rolling the lower back (stick to upper back).
injury_prevention_tips: Avoid rolling directly on the spine or bony areas.
Keep core engaged to protect the spine.

name: Rocking Standing Calf Raise
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand with a barbell on your upper back, feet shoulder-width.
Raise your heels as high as possible, pausing at the top.
Lower heels below the platform to stretch calves.
Rock onto your toes, then lift your toes to work shin muscles.
form_cues: Keep knees slightly bent, not locked.
Control the up and down motion.
common_mistakes: Using too much weight, limiting range.
injury_prevention_tips: Use a controlled tempo to avoid Achilles strain.
Keep core braced to protect the lower back.

name: Rocky Pull-Ups/Pulldowns
beginner_friendly_instructions: Grab a pull-up bar with a wide overhand grip.
Lean back slightly, chest up, and pull the bar to your upper chest.
Lower with control to a full stretch.
Repeat, this time pulling to the back of your neck (behind head).
common_mistakes: Pulling with arms instead of back.
injury_prevention_tips: Avoid pulling behind the neck if you have neck/shoulder issues.
Keep wrists neutral.

name: Romanian Deadlift
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand with a barbell in front of you, feet hip-width.
Hold the bar with a pronated grip, slight bend in knees.
Hinge at hips, pushing butt back, lowering bar down shins while keeping back flat.
Stop when you feel a stretch in hamstrings, then drive hips forward to stand.
common_mistakes: Bending knees too much (like a squat).
Letting the bar drift away from legs.
injury_prevention_tips: Brace core throughout the lift.
Stop at a comfortable range; do not force depth.

name: Rope Climb
beginner_friendly_instructions: Grab the rope with both hands, arms extended overhead.
Jump slightly and wrap the rope around one foot, pinching with the other.
Pull yourself up with your arms, then reposition your hands higher.
Extend legs and stand up, repeating until you reach the top.
common_mistakes: Pulling only with arms, ignoring legs.
injury_prevention_tips: Use a mat below for safety.
Wear gloves to protect hands if needed.

name: Rope Crunch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Kneel 1-2 feet from a cable machine with a rope attachment.
Hold rope ends by your head, arms straight.
Curl your torso down, bringing ribs toward hips.
Pause at the bottom, then slowly return.
form_cues: Round your spine to target abs.
common_mistakes: Using hips to pull the weight.
Pulling with arms instead of abs.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep neck neutral; do not pull with head.
Use moderate weight to avoid lower back strain.

name: Rope Straight-Arm Pulldown
beginner_friendly_instructions: Attach a rope to a high pulley. Stand a few feet back, hinge forward slightly.
Hold rope with straight arms, palms facing each other.
Pull rope down to thighs by moving arms down and back, squeezing lats.
Return slowly without letting the weight stack touch.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep shoulders down and relaxed.
Avoid heavy weights that cause you to compromise form.

name: Round The World Shoulder Stretch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand holding a broomstick or bar behind your hips.
Grip wider than shoulder-width, palms down.
Slowly lift the bar up and behind your head.
Return to start if it feels too intense.
injury_prevention_tips: Stop if you feel sharp shoulder pain.
Keep core engaged to avoid arching lower back.

name: Runner's Stretch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Step one foot forward into a lunge, back knee down.
Place hands on the floor inside the front foot.
Push hips back and straighten the front leg to stretch the hamstring.
Hold, then switch sides.
injury_prevention_tips: Warm up before stretching.
Avoid if you feel knee pain in the back leg.

name: Russian Twist
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit with knees bent, feet off the floor, leaning back to form a V-shape.
Clasp hands in front of you.
Twist torso to one side, then the other.
Keep movement controlled.
form_cues: Twist from the ribs, not arms.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep neck neutral; do not lead with head.
Start without weight to master the form.

name: Scapular Pull-Up
beginner_friendly_instructions: Hang from a pull-up bar with an overhand grip.
Without bending elbows, pull shoulder blades down and back.
Pause when chest lifts slightly.
Slowly release to a full hang.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep neck relaxed.
Do not over-shrug; focus on depression.

name: Scissor Kick
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on your back, hands under hips for support.
Lift legs slightly off the floor.
Alternate lifting one leg up and the other down in a controlled motion.
Keep lower back pressed into the floor.
injury_prevention_tips: Place hands under hips to support the spine.
Stop if you feel lower back strain.

name: Seated Band Hamstring Curl
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on a bench with a resistance band anchored low in front of you.
Loop band around ankles, start with legs straight.
Curl heels toward bench by bending knees.
Slowly straighten legs back out.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep knees aligned with hips.
Avoid rounding the lower back.

name: Seated Barbell Military Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on a bench with back support, hold barbell at shoulder height.
Grip wider than shoulder-width, palms forward.
Press bar overhead until arms are straight.
Lower bar back to shoulders with control.
form_cues: Press bar in a straight line.
common_mistakes: Pressing bar too far back or forward.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep wrists neutral.
Use a spotter for heavy sets.

name: Seated Barbell Twist
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on a bench, hold a barbell behind your head, resting on upper back.
Keep feet planted, chest up.
Twist torso side to side in a controlled manner.
Do not force the range.
common_mistakes: Using arms to swing the bar.
injury_prevention_tips: Use light weight only.
Stop if you feel lower back pain.

name: Seated Bent-Over One-Arm Dumbbell Triceps Extension
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on a bench, hinge forward with a flat back.
Hold one dumbbell with a neutral grip, elbow bent at 90 degrees.
Extend arm back until straight, squeezing triceps.
Return slowly.
injury_prevention_tips: Use light weight to protect the elbow.
Keep wrist neutral.

name: Seated Bent-Over Rear Delt Raise
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on the edge of a bench, hinge forward with a flat back.
Hold light dumbbells, palms facing each other.
Lift arms out to the sides, squeezing shoulder blades.
Lower with control.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep wrists neutral.
Avoid excessive internal rotation at the bottom.

name: Seated Bent-Over Two-Arm Dumbbell Triceps Extension
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on a bench, hinge forward with a flat back.
Hold two dumbbells with neutral grips, elbows bent at 90 degrees.
Extend arms back until straight, squeezing triceps.
Return slowly.
injury_prevention_tips: Use light weight to protect the elbows.
Keep wrists neutral.

name: Seated Biceps
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on the floor with knees bent, partner standing behind you.
Extend arms straight back, palms facing each other.
Partner holds your wrists.
Try to flex elbows while partner resists, then relax and let partner gently pull arms forward.
injury_prevention_tips: Never force a stretch into pain.
Warm up before PNF stretching.

name: Seated Cable Rows
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit at a low cable row machine with a V-bar handle.
Place feet on platform, knees slightly bent.
Pull handle toward lower abdomen, squeezing back muscles.
Return slowly, keeping tension on the cable.
injury_prevention_tips: Brace core to protect spine.
Keep wrists neutral.

name: Seated Cable Shoulder Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit at a low cable machine with handles set at shoulder height.
Hold handles with palms forward, elbows bent at 90 degrees.
Press handles overhead until arms are straight.
Lower with control.
common_mistakes: Pressing handles too far forward or back.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep wrists neutral.
Use a weight that allows full control.

name: Seated Machine Calf Raise
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on the machine, place toes on the platform, heels off.
Place pads on your knees, hold handles.
Raise heels as high as possible, pause.
Lower heels below the platform for a stretch.
common_mistakes: Using too much weight, limiting range.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep feet aligned with knees.
Avoid locking knees.

name: Seated Calf Stretch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit with one leg extended, the other bent.
Loop a band or towel around the ball of the extended foot.
Pull toes toward you until you feel a stretch in the calf.
Hold, then switch sides.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep the stretch gentle; avoid pain.
Warm up calves before stretching.

name: Seated Close-Grip Concentration Barbell Curl
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on a bench, hold a barbell or EZ bar between legs.
Place back of upper arms on inner thighs, close grip.
Curl the bar up toward shoulders, squeezing biceps.
Lower slowly.
common_mistakes: Using a grip that's too wide.
injury_prevention_tips: Use light weight to isolate the biceps.
Avoid excessive wrist flexion.

name: Seated Dumbbell Curl
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on a bench, hold dumbbells at sides, palms facing body.
Curl weights up, rotating palms to face forward at the top.
Squeeze biceps, then lower with control, rotating back.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep wrists neutral.
Use a weight that allows full control.

name: Seated Dumbbell Inner Biceps Curl
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on a bench, hold dumbbells at sides, palms facing each other (neutral).
Curl weights up and out, rotating palms to face forward.
Squeeze biceps at the top, then lower with control.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep shoulders down.
Avoid excessive wrist rotation.

name: Seated Dumbbell Palms-Down Wrist Curl
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on a bench, hold dumbbells with palms down, forearms on thighs.
Let wrists hang over knees.
Curl wrists up, lifting the weight.
Lower slowly.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep wrists neutral at the bottom.
Avoid jerking the weight.

name: Seated Dumbbell Palms-Up Wrist Curl
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on a bench, hold dumbbells with palms up, forearms on thighs.
Let wrists hang over knees.
Curl wrists up, lifting the weight.
Lower slowly.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep wrists neutral at the bottom.
Avoid jerking the weight.

name: Seated Dumbbell Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on a bench with back support, hold dumbbells at shoulder height.
Palms facing forward.
Press dumbbells overhead until arms are straight.
Lower with control.
common_mistakes: Pressing dumbbells too far forward or back.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep wrists neutral.
Use a weight that allows full control.

name: Seated Flat Bench Leg Pull-In
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on a bench, hands gripping edges, legs extended.
Lean back slightly.
Pull knees toward chest while bringing torso forward.
Return slowly.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep neck neutral.
Avoid if you have lower back issues.

name: Seated Floor Hamstring Stretch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on the floor with one leg extended, the other bent with foot against inner thigh.
Hinge at hips and reach toward the extended foot.
Keep back flat.
Hold, then switch sides.
form_cues: Keep extended knee slightly bent if needed.
common_mistakes: Bending the extended knee too much.
injury_prevention_tips: Stop if you feel sharp pain.
Warm up before stretching.

name: Seated Front Deltoid
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit upright, partner behind you.
Extend arms straight out to sides, palms down.
Partner holds wrists.
Try to move arms forward while partner resists, then relax and let partner gently push arms forward.
injury_prevention_tips: Never force a stretch into pain.
Warm up before PNF stretching.

name: Seated Glute
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit with knees bent, cross one ankle over opposite knee.
Partner stands behind you.
Lean forward slightly, partner holds your shoulders.
Try to push torso back while partner resists, then relax and let partner gently push you forward.
injury_prevention_tips: Never force a stretch into pain.
Warm up before PNF stretching.

name: Seated Good Mornings
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on a box or bench, barbell on upper back.
Keep chest up, back straight.
Hinge forward at hips, lowering torso toward floor.
Return to upright position.
injury_prevention_tips: Use light weight only.
Keep neck neutral.

name: Seated Hamstring
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit upright, partner behind you.
Extend legs forward.
Partner holds your shoulders.
Try to push torso back while partner resists, then relax and let partner gently push you forward.
injury_prevention_tips: Never force a stretch into pain.
Warm up before PNF stretching.

name: Seated Hamstring and Calf Stretch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit with legs extended.
Loop a band or towel around one foot.
Pull toes toward you to stretch calf and hamstring.
Hold, then switch sides.
form_cues: Keep knees straight but not locked.
injury_prevention_tips: Stop if you feel sharp pain.
Warm up before stretching.

name: Seated Head Harness Neck Resistance
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on a bench, head harness with light weight.
Look straight ahead.
Slowly nod forward, bringing chin to chest.
Return to neutral.
injury_prevention_tips: Use very light weight.
Stop if you feel neck pain.

name: Seated Leg Curl
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on the machine, adjust pad to just above heels.
Secure lap pad over thighs.
Curl legs back, squeezing hamstrings.
Return slowly.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep knees aligned with hips.
Avoid locking knees at the start.

name: Seated Leg Tucks
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on a bench, hands gripping edges, legs extended.
Lean back slightly.
Pull knees toward chest while bringing torso forward.
Return slowly.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep neck neutral.
Avoid if you have lower back issues.

name: Seated One-Arm Dumbbell Palms-Down Wrist Curl
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on a bench, place one forearm on thigh, palm down.
Hold dumbbell with that hand, wrist hanging off knee.
Curl wrist up, lifting weight.
Lower slowly.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep wrist neutral at the bottom.
Avoid jerking the weight.

name: Seated One-Arm Dumbbell Palms-Up Wrist Curl
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on a bench and hold a dumbbell in one hand.
Rest your forearm on your thigh with your palm facing up, wrist hanging off your knee.
Lower the weight by bending your wrist down, then curl it back up.
form_cues: Keep your forearm glued to your thigh.
Only move your wrist, not your elbow.
Squeeze your forearm at the top of the curl.
common_mistakes: Using the shoulder to create momentum.
Moving the elbow up and down.
injury_prevention_tips: Avoid dropping the weight too quickly; control the eccentric to protect the wrist joint.
Do not hyperextend the wrist at the bottom.

name: Seated One-arm Cable Pulley Rows
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit at a cable row machine with feet planted and knees slightly bent.
Grab the handle with one hand and lean back slightly, keeping your back straight.
Pull the handle toward your hip, squeezing your back muscles.
form_cues: Keep your chest up and back slightly arched.
Pull the handle close to your body.
Squeeze your shoulder blade back at the end of the movement.
common_mistakes: Jerking the weight with the torso.
injury_prevention_tips: Maintain a neutral spine throughout the movement.
Control the weight on the way back to avoid shoulder strain.

name: Seated Overhead Stretch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on the floor with feet together in front of you.
Place one hand on the floor for support and the other behind your head.
Lift your elbow toward the ceiling while leaning to the opposite side.
form_cues: Keep your hips on the ground.
Lean gently; do not force the stretch.
Breathe deeply to relax into the stretch.
common_mistakes: Lifting the hip off the floor.
Pulling on the head too hard.
injury_prevention_tips: Move slowly into the stretch to avoid muscle spasms.
Do not force the range of motion.

name: Seated Palm-Up Barbell Wrist Curl
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on a bench holding a barbell with palms facing up.
Rest your forearms on your thighs, wrists hanging off your knees.
Lower the bar by bending your wrists down, then curl them back up.
form_cues: Control the descent of the bar.
common_mistakes: Using the biceps to curl the weight.
Lifting the forearms off the thighs.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with a light weight to avoid wrist strain.
Do not let the bar slip out of your grip at the bottom.

name: Seated Palms-Down Barbell Wrist Curl
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on a bench holding a barbell with palms facing down.
Rest your forearms on your thighs, wrists hanging off your knees.
Lower the bar by extending your wrists up, then curl them back down.
form_cues: Focus on the top of the forearm.
Keep a firm grip on the bar.
injury_prevention_tips: Avoid dropping the weight; use a controlled motion.
Ensure wrists are neutral before starting.

name: Seated Side Lateral Raise
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on a bench holding dumbbells at your sides, palms facing in.
Keep your torso still and raise the weights out to the side.
Lift until your arms are parallel to the floor.
form_cues: Keep a slight bend in the elbow.
common_mistakes: Using momentum to lift the weight.
Shrugging the shoulders at the top.
injury_prevention_tips: Do not lift heavier than you can control.
Keep the wrist neutral to avoid joint stress.

name: Seated Triceps Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on a bench with back support and hold a dumbbell overhead with both hands.
Lower the weight behind your head by bending your elbows.
Extend your arms back up to the starting position.
form_cues: Keep your elbows pointing forward, not flaring out.
Squeeze your triceps at the top.
common_mistakes: Moving the upper arms forward and back.
injury_prevention_tips: Do not hyperextend the elbow at the top.
Use a weight you can control to prevent dropping it on your head.

name: Seated Two-Arm Palms-Up Low-Pulley Wrist Curl
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on a bench in front of a low cable machine with a bar attachment.
Hold the bar with palms facing up and rest forearms on your thighs.
Lower the bar by extending your wrists, then curl it back up.
form_cues: Maintain constant tension on the cable.
injury_prevention_tips: Ensure the cable is set low enough to allow full range of motion.
Do not let the bar slip at the bottom.

name: See-Saw Press (Alternating Side Press)
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand holding dumbbells at shoulder height, palms facing you.
Press one dumbbell overhead while rotating the palm to face forward.
Simultaneously bend slightly to the opposite side, then alternate sides.
form_cues: Fully lock out the arm at the top.
common_mistakes: Bending too far to the side.
Using the back to generate momentum.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep the spine neutral.
Do not use excessive weight that compromises balance.

name: Shotgun Row
beginner_friendly_instructions: Attach a single handle to a low cable.
Stand with a split stance and grab the handle with one hand.
Pull the handle up toward your shoulder, keeping your elbow high.
form_cues: Keep the elbow close to the body.
Supinate the wrist (turn palm up) at the top.
common_mistakes: Pulling with the bicep instead of the back.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep the lower back neutral.
Avoid jerking the weight.

name: Shoulder Circles
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand or sit with arms relaxed at your sides.
Roll your shoulders forward in a circular motion.
Reverse the direction after a few reps.
form_cues: Make the circles large but controlled.
common_mistakes: Going too fast and losing control.
injury_prevention_tips: Stop if you feel pinching in the shoulder joint.
Perform slowly to warm up the joint.

name: Shoulder Press - With Bands
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand on the middle of a resistance band.
Hold the handles at shoulder height, palms facing forward.
Press the handles overhead until arms are straight.
injury_prevention_tips: Check the band for tears before use.
Keep the wrists neutral.

name: Shoulder Raise
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand with arms at your sides.
Shrug your shoulders up toward your ears.
Lower them back down slowly.
injury_prevention_tips: Do not use heavy weights if doing weighted shrugs.
Keep the movement within a pain-free range.

name: Shoulder Stretch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand tall.
Reach your left arm across your body.
Use your right hand to gently hold the left arm in place.
common_mistakes: Pulling too hard on the arm.
Lifting the shoulder toward the ear.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep the stretch gentle.
Do not force the range of motion.

name: Side-Lying Floor Stretch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on your side with one knee bent for stability.
Extend the top arm over your head.
Gently pull the wrist to deepen the stretch.
form_cues: Feel the stretch along the ribs.
injury_prevention_tips: Do not yank the wrist.
Ensure the bottom shoulder is not compressed.

name: Side Bridge
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on your side with legs straight and stacked.
Prop yourself up on your forearm, lifting your hips off the ground.
Hold the position, keeping a straight line from head to feet.
injury_prevention_tips: Do not let the shoulder collapse inward.
Stop if you feel lower back pain.

name: Side Jackknife
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on your side with legs straight.
Simultaneously bring knees and torso toward each other.
Touch your knee to your elbow, then extend back out.
injury_prevention_tips: Move slowly to protect the spine.
Keep the neck neutral.

name: Side Lateral Raise
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand holding dumbbells at your sides, palms facing in.
Raise the weights out to the side until arms are parallel to the floor.
Lower them back down slowly.
form_cues: Keep a slight bend in the elbow.
injury_prevention_tips: Do not use momentum.
Keep wrists neutral.

name: Side Laterals to Front Raise
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand holding dumbbells at your sides.
Raise weights to the side to shoulder height.
At the top, move weights forward into a front raise, then reverse.
injury_prevention_tips: Use light weights to maintain control.
Do not lock elbows.

name: Side Leg Raises
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand next to a sturdy object for balance.
Lift one leg straight out to the side.
Lower it back down with control.
injury_prevention_tips: Do not lift the leg higher than comfortable.
Keep the hips square.

name: Side Lying Groin Stretch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on your side with bottom leg bent for support.
Grab the top leg behind the knee or ankle.
Gently pull the leg toward your chest.
form_cues: Relax the hip of the top leg.
injury_prevention_tips: Move slowly into the stretch.
Do not force the knee joint.

name: Side Neck Stretch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit or stand tall.
Tilt your head toward one shoulder.
Use your hand to gently pull the head further down.
injury_prevention_tips: Be gentle with the neck.
Do not compress the spine.

name: Side To Side Chins
beginner_friendly_instructions: Grab a pull-up bar with a wide grip, palms facing forward.
Pull yourself up while leaning to the left side.
Lower down and repeat leaning to the right side.
form_cues: Pull the chest toward the bar.
injury_prevention_tips: Do not hyperextend the elbows at the bottom.
Ensure the bar is secure.

name: Side Wrist Pull
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand and cross one arm over your body.
Grab the wrist with the opposite hand.
Gently straighten the crossed arm while pulling it across.
form_cues: Feel the stretch in the forearm.
Keep the arm straight but not locked.
injury_prevention_tips: Move slowly.
Do not force the joint.

name: Single-Arm Cable Crossover
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set a cable pulley to shoulder height.
Stand sideways to the machine and grab the handle with one hand.
Pull the handle across your body while keeping a slight bend in the elbow.
form_cues: Squeeze the chest at the end.
common_mistakes: Using the arm instead of the chest.
injury_prevention_tips: Do not let the weight stack slam down.
Keep the shoulder blade stable.

name: Single-Arm Linear Jammer
beginner_friendly_instructions: Load a barbell into a landmine.
Stand in a staggered stance and grip the end of the bar with one hand.
Press the bar up and forward by extending your hips and knees.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep the spine neutral.
Do not lock the knees at the top.

name: Single-Arm Push-Up
beginner_friendly_instructions: Get into a plank position with one hand under your shoulder.
Place the other hand behind your back.
Lower your chest to the floor, then push back up.
form_cues: Keep the elbow at a 45-degree angle.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with elevated push-ups if too difficult.
Do not let the shoulder collapse.

name: Single-Leg High Box Squat
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand in front of a high box or bench.
Balance on one leg and place the other foot on the box.
Drive through the heel to stand up, then lower back down.
common_mistakes: Using the trailing leg to push.
injury_prevention_tips: Ensure the box height is appropriate.
Do not let the knee travel past the toes excessively.

name: Single-Leg Leg Extension
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit in a leg extension machine.
Place one shin under the pad.
Extend the leg until straight, then lower slowly.
form_cues: Squeeze the quad at the top.
injury_prevention_tips: Do not lock the knee joint.
Ensure the pad is just above the ankle.

name: Single Dumbbell Raise
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand holding a dumbbell with both hands by the head of the weight.
Keep arms straight and raise the weight overhead.
Lower it back down with control.
form_cues: Squeeze the shoulders at the top.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep the spine neutral.
Do not use a weight that forces you to swing.

name: Single Leg Glute Bridge
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat.
Lift one leg off the ground.
Drive through the heel to lift your hips, then lower.
form_cues: Squeeze the glute at the top.
Do not overarch the lower back.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep the neck relaxed.
Do not hyperextend the lower back.

name: Sit-Up
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet anchored.
Place hands behind your head.
Sit up until your torso is upright, then lower back down.
form_cues: Engage the abs, not the hip flexors.
injury_prevention_tips: Do not round the back aggressively on the way down.
Anchor feet lightly; do not weigh them down.

name: Sit Squats
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
Sit back into a squat, stopping above parallel.
Stand back up quickly.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep the weight in the mid-foot.
Do not bounce at the bottom.

name: Sled Overhead Backward Walk
beginner_friendly_instructions: Attach handles to a sled and load light weight.
Face away from the sled and hold handles overhead.
Walk backward, keeping arms extended.
form_cues: Do not hyperextend the lower back.
common_mistakes: Walking too fast and losing control.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with very light weight.
Ensure the path behind you is clear.

name: Sled Overhead Triceps Extension
beginner_friendly_instructions: Attach a rope to a sled and face away.
Hold the rope overhead with hands together.
Extend your arms to push the rope up, then lower.
injury_prevention_tips: Do not lock the elbows aggressively.
Keep the spine neutral.

name: Sled Reverse Flye
beginner_friendly_instructions: Attach handles to a sled and face away.
Hold handles at waist level with palms facing each other.
Raise arms out to the sides, squeezing shoulder blades.
form_cues: Keep a slight bend in the elbows.
injury_prevention_tips: Use light weight.
Do not hyperextend the lower back.

name: Sled Row
beginner_friendly_instructions: Attach handles to a sled and face away.
Hold handles with arms extended.
Pull the handles toward your hips by bending elbows and squeezing back.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep the spine neutral.
Do not jerk the weight.

name: Smith Incline Shoulder Raise
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set an incline bench under a Smith machine.
Lie back and grip the bar slightly wider than shoulder width.
Lower the bar to your upper chest, then press back up.
form_cues: Keep the elbows under the bar.
injury_prevention_tips: Do not bounce the bar off the chest.
Keep wrists neutral.

name: Smith Machine Behind the Back Shrug
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand with the bar behind you, gripping it with arms straight.
Shrug your shoulders up toward your ears.
Lower them back down slowly.
injury_prevention_tips: Do not use weight that causes pain.
Keep the spine neutral.

name: Smith Machine Bench Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on a flat bench under the Smith machine.
Grip the bar wider than shoulder width.
Lower the bar to the mid-chest, then press back up.
common_mistakes: Bouncing the bar off the chest.
injury_prevention_tips: Do not let the wrists bend back.
Use safety catches.

name: Smith Machine Bent Over Row
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set the bar at knee height and load weight.
Bend over with a flat back, gripping the bar.
Pull the bar toward your lower chest.
form_cues: Squeeze the back at the top.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep the neck neutral.
Do not jerk the weight.

name: Smith Machine Calf Raise
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand on a block or plates under the Smith bar.
Place the bar on your shoulders.
Raise your heels as high as possible, then lower.
injury_prevention_tips: Ensure the bar is secure.
Do not let the heels drop quickly.

name: Smith Machine Close-Grip Bench Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on a flat bench under the Smith machine.
Grip the bar with hands shoulder-width apart.
Lower the bar to the chest, keeping elbows tucked.
form_cues: Keep elbows close to the body.
injury_prevention_tips: Use safety catches.
Do not bounce the bar.

name: Smith Machine Decline Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set a decline bench under the Smith machine.
Grip the bar and unlock it.
Lower the bar to the lower chest, then press up.
injury_prevention_tips: Ensure the bench is secure.
Do not overstretch at the bottom.

name: Smith Machine Hang Power Clean
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set the bar at knee height.
Grip the bar and stand up straight.
Explosively extend hips and knees, then pull the bar to the shoulders.
form_cues: Catch the bar with high elbows.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with light weight.
Keep the spine neutral.

name: Smith Machine Hip Raise
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on a bench with feet against the Smith bar.
Lift your hips by flexing the spine.
Squeeze glutes at the top, then lower.
common_mistakes: Using the lower back instead of glutes.
injury_prevention_tips: Do not hyperextend the spine.
Keep the neck neutral.

name: Smith Machine Incline Bench Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set an incline bench under the Smith machine.
Grip the bar wider than shoulder width.
Lower the bar to the upper chest, then press up.
injury_prevention_tips: Use safety catches.
Do not overstretch at the bottom.

name: Smith Machine Leg Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on the floor under the Smith machine with knees bent.
Place feet on the bar and unhook it.
Push the bar up by extending hips and knees, then lower.
form_cues: Keep the back flat on the floor.
common_mistakes: Lifting the hips off the floor.
injury_prevention_tips: Ensure the bar is secure.
Do not use too much weight.

name: Smith Machine One-Arm Upright Row
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand with the bar at thigh level.
Grip the bar with one hand.
Pull the bar up toward the shoulder, keeping the elbow high.
form_cues: Keep the bar close to the body.
Squeeze the shoulder at the top.
injury_prevention_tips: Do not use too much weight.
Keep the wrist neutral.

name: Smith Machine Overhead Shoulder Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit under the Smith machine with a bench.
Grip the bar and press it overhead.
Lower the bar to chin level, then press back up.
injury_prevention_tips: Do not hyperextend the neck.
Use safety catches.

name: Smith Machine Pistol Squat
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set the bar to shoulder height and step under it, placing it across your upper back.
Unrack the weight and stand on one leg, extending the other leg straight out in front of you.
Slowly lower yourself down by bending your standing knee, keeping your chest up.
Drive through your heel to return to the starting position.
form_cues: Keep your chest up and core tight.
Drive your knee outwards, don't let it cave in.
Control the descent; don't drop down quickly.
common_mistakes: Letting the knee of the working leg collapse inward (valgus collapse).
Leaning too far forward, shifting stress away from the quads.
Using momentum instead of muscular control.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with a very light weight or just the bar to master balance.
Only go as deep as you can maintain a neutral spine.

name: Smith Machine Reverse Calf Raises
beginner_friendly_instructions: Place a sturdy platform under the bar. Stand on it with just the balls of your feet on the edge.
Place the bar across your upper back and stand up tall.
Keep a slight bend in your knees.
Lower your heels as far as possible, then press up onto your toes as high as you can.
form_cues: Keep your knees slightly bent but locked in that angle.
Pause at the top and squeeze the calves.
Control the movement; don't bounce at the bottom.
common_mistakes: Bouncing at the bottom of the movement (using stretch reflex).
Moving too fast and losing tension.
Not getting full range of motion (heels dropping low enough).
injury_prevention_tips: Ensure the platform is stable and won't slip.
Keep your core engaged to protect your lower back.

name: Smith Machine Squat
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set the bar to just below shoulder height and step under it.
Unrack the weight and step back. Set your feet shoulder-width apart, toes slightly out.
Keep your chest up and look forward. Lower down by bending your knees and hips.
Drive through your heels to stand back up.
form_cues: Keep your chest proud and spine neutral.
Push your knees out in line with your toes.
common_mistakes: Rising onto your toes at the top.
injury_prevention_tips: Ensure your feet are placed evenly.
Don't lock your knees out aggressively at the top.

name: Smith Machine Stiff-Legged Deadlift
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set the bar at mid-thigh height. Stand with feet hip-width apart.
Unrack the bar and stand tall with a slight bend in your knees.
Hinge at your hips, pushing your butt back while lowering the bar down your legs.
Stop when you feel a stretch in your hamstrings, then drive hips forward to stand.
form_cues: Keep the bar close to your legs.
Feel the stretch in the hamstrings, not the lower back.
common_mistakes: Rounding the back to reach further down.
Bending the knees too much (turning it into a squat).
Letting the bar drift away from the body.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep a slight bend in the knees to protect the joints.
Stop the movement once you feel a deep hamstring stretch.

name: Smith Machine Upright Row
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set the bar to mid-thigh height. Stand with feet hip-width apart.
Grab the bar with a narrow grip (hands about 6-8 inches apart).
Keep the bar close to your body and pull your elbows up high.
Lower the bar slowly back down.
form_cues: Lead with your elbows, not your hands.
Keep elbows higher than forearms at the top.
Keep the bar close to your body.
common_mistakes: Using too much weight and shrugging excessively.
Pulling with the arms instead of the shoulders.
injury_prevention_tips: Use a lighter weight to ensure proper form.
If you feel shoulder pain, switch to a wider grip or stop.

name: Smith Single-Leg Split Squat
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set the bar to shoulder height and step under it.
Unrack the weight and step one foot forward, the other foot back onto a bench.
Lower your body straight down by bending your front knee.
Drive through your front heel to return to the start.
form_cues: Ensure your front knee tracks over your foot.
Squeeze your glute at the top.
common_mistakes: Letting the front knee cave inward.
Placing the front foot too far forward (reduces quad stimulus).
injury_prevention_tips: Ensure the bench is stable.
Don't let your front knee travel past your toes excessively.

name: Snatch Pull
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand with feet hip-width, bar over mid-foot. Hinge hips back and grab the bar.
Keep arms straight and chest up. Drive through heels to lift the bar.
As the bar passes your knees, explode hips forward and jump.
Keep arms straight the entire time; do not pull with elbows.
form_cues: Keep the bar close to your body.
common_mistakes: Shrugging at the top instead of extending.
Letting the bar drift away from the body.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with a light weight to master the timing.
Keep your core braced to protect your spine.

name: Speed Band Overhead Triceps
beginner_friendly_instructions: Anchor a band under your foot or a bench.
Grab the band behind your head with elbows pointing up.
Extend your arms straight up overhead.
Control the movement back down.
form_cues: Keep elbows close to your head.
Lock out elbows at the top.
common_mistakes: Letting the band snap back down.
injury_prevention_tips: Check the band for tears before using.
Don't hyperextend your elbows at the top.

name: Speed Box Squat
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set a box behind you at parallel height. Stand with bar on back.
Sit back onto the box with control.
Pause briefly (don't relax) on the box.
Explode back up to standing.
form_cues: Keep tension in your glutes on the box.
injury_prevention_tips: Ensure the box is stable.
Use a weight that allows for explosive movement, not max grinding.

name: Speed Squats
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set bar to shoulder height and step under it.
Feet shoulder-width, toes slightly out.
Lower down with control, then drive up as fast as possible.
Keep form perfect; speed is the goal.
injury_prevention_tips: Use 50-70% of your 1RM.
Stop if form breaks down.

name: Spell Caster
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand with feet wide, holding a dumbbell with both hands.
Squat down slightly and rotate torso to swing the dumbbell to one hip.
Rotate through and swing the dumbbell to the other hip.
Keep arms straight and move in a controlled arc.
common_mistakes: Using arms to lift instead of hips.
Moving too fast and losing control.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with a light weight.
Ensure you have enough space around you.

name: Spider Crawl
beginner_friendly_instructions: Start in a high plank position.
Lift one foot off the ground.
Bring your knee toward your elbow on the same side.
Return to start and switch sides.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep wrists directly under shoulders.
Engage glutes to stabilize the pelvis.

name: Spider Curl
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie face down on an incline bench (45 degrees).
Let your arms hang straight down, holding a bar or dumbbells.
Curl the weight up while keeping your upper arm stationary.
Lower slowly back down.
form_cues: Keep chest pressed into the bench.
injury_prevention_tips: Don't hyperextend your elbows at the bottom.
Ensure the bench is secure.

name: Spinal Stretch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on a chair, fingers interlaced behind head.
Twist your torso to one side.
Lean forward slightly and twist deeper.
Return to center and switch sides.
injury_prevention_tips: Move within a pain-free range.
Avoid if you have acute disc issues.

name: Split Squat with Dumbbells
beginner_friendly_instructions: Step one foot forward, one back (staggered stance).
Hold dumbbells at your sides.
Lower your body straight down by bending both knees.
Drive through your front heel to stand up.
injury_prevention_tips: Ensure knees don't hurt; adjust stance width if needed.
Keep core tight.

name: Split Squats
beginner_friendly_instructions: Start standing, jump into a lunge position.
Lower hips slightly.
Jump back up and switch leg positions.
Repeat rhythmically.
injury_prevention_tips: Use soft surface if possible.
Warm up ankles and knees.

name: Squat Jerk
beginner_friendly_instructions: Rack bar on front shoulders. Feet under hips.
Dip slightly (bend knees), then explode up.
As bar leaves shoulders, drop under into a squat.
Catch bar overhead with locked arms, then stand up.
injury_prevention_tips: Master the movement with a PVC pipe first.
Ensure overhead mobility is adequate.

name: Squat with Bands
beginner_friendly_instructions: Loop bands over the bar and anchor them low.
Set up for a back squat.
Lower down with control (bands will stretch).
Drive up, fighting the band tension.
injury_prevention_tips: Secure bands properly so they don't snap.
Start with light bands to get used to the tension.

name: Squat with Chains
beginner_friendly_instructions: Loop chains over the bar so they hang on the floor.
Set up for a back squat.
Lower down (chains pile up, less weight).
Stand up (chains lift, more weight).
injury_prevention_tips: Ensure chains are secure.
Don't let chains snap back down.

name: Squat with Plate Movers
beginner_friendly_instructions: Place a weight plate on the floor. Stand on one side holding a barbell.
Perform a squat.
At the top, step over the plate to the other side.
Use your foot to push the plate to the new side. Repeat.
injury_prevention_tips: Use a smooth floor for the plate.
Don't step on the plate.

name: Squats - With Bands
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand on the middle of a resistance band.
Hold the handles at shoulder height.
Squat down by bending knees and hips.
Stand back up against the band tension.
injury_prevention_tips: Ensure band is not frayed.
Keep feet planted firmly.

name: Standing Alternating Dumbbell Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand holding dumbbells at shoulders.
Press one dumbbell overhead.
Lower it back down and press the other.
Alternate arms.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep glutes squeezed to stabilize.
Don't let dumbbells drift behind head.

name: Standing Barbell Calf Raise
beginner_friendly_instructions: Place bar on upper back (like a squat).
Stand with feet hip-width.
Lift heels as high as possible.
Lower heels until stretched.
injury_prevention_tips: Use a block for deeper range if stable.
Keep core tight to protect spine.

name: Standing Barbell Press Behind Neck
beginner_friendly_instructions: Rack bar behind head on traps.
Grip wide.
Press bar straight up overhead.
Lower back to traps.
injury_prevention_tips: Avoid if you have shoulder issues.
Use very light weight initially.

name: Standing Bent-Over One-Arm Dumbbell Triceps Extension
beginner_friendly_instructions: Bend over until torso is near parallel to floor.
Hold dumbbell in one hand, upper arm parallel to floor.
Extend arm back until straight.
Lower back down.
injury_prevention_tips: Support yourself with free hand on knee.
Keep neck neutral.

name: Standing Bent-Over Two-Arm Dumbbell Triceps Extension
beginner_friendly_instructions: Bend over until torso is near parallel to floor.
Hold dumbbells in both hands, upper arms parallel to floor.
Extend arms back until straight.
Lower back down.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep core braced.
Don't hyperextend elbows.

name: Standing Biceps Cable Curl
beginner_friendly_instructions: Attach bar/handle to low cable.
Stand tall, elbows tucked at sides.
Curl weight up toward shoulders.
Lower slowly.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep wrists neutral.
Don't hyperextend elbows at bottom.

name: Standing Biceps Stretch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Clasp hands behind back.
Straighten arms.
Rotate palms down.
Raise arms up until stretch is felt.
injury_prevention_tips: Don't force the stretch.
Stop if you feel sharp pain.

name: Standing Bradford Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Hold bar at front shoulders.
Press overhead.
Lower bar behind head.
Press back to front shoulders.
injury_prevention_tips: Use light weight.
Ensure shoulder mobility allows for behind-neck movement.

name: Standing Cable Chest Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set cables to chest height.
Stand between them, stagger stance.
Press handles forward and together.
Return slowly.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep wrists neutral.
Don't let cables pull you forward.

name: Standing Cable Lift
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set cable to lowest setting. Stand sideways.
Grab handle with both hands.
Squat down and rotate torso.
Stand up and rotate, bringing handle overhead.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep spine neutral.
Don't jerk the weight.

name: Standing Cable Wood Chop
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set cable to high setting. Stand sideways.
Grab handle with both hands.
Pull handle down and across body to opposite knee.
Return slowly.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep core engaged.
Control the eccentric.

name: Standing Machine Calf Raise
beginner_friendly_instructions: Step under pads of machine.
Place balls of feet on platform.
Lift heels as high as possible.
Lower heels until stretched.
injury_prevention_tips: Ensure safety latch is engaged.
Don't lock knees violently.

name: Standing Concentration Curl
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lean forward, supporting arm on knee.
Hold dumbbell in hanging arm.
Curl weight up to shoulder.
Lower slowly.
form_cues: Keep elbow pinned to inner thigh.
injury_prevention_tips: Don't hyperextend elbow at bottom.
Keep neck neutral.

name: Standing Dumbbell Calf Raise
beginner_friendly_instructions: Hold dumbbells at sides.
Stand on a block or step (balls of feet on edge).
Lift heels as high as possible.
Lower heels until stretched.
injury_prevention_tips: Ensure block is stable.
Keep core tight.

name: Standing Dumbbell Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Hold dumbbells at shoulder height.
Press straight up overhead.
Lock out elbows.
Lower back to shoulders.
injury_prevention_tips: Squeeze glutes to stabilize.
Don't let dumbbells drift behind head.

name: Standing Dumbbell Reverse Curl
beginner_friendly_instructions: Hold dumbbells with palms facing down.
Keep elbows tucked at sides.
Curl weight up toward shoulders.
Lower slowly.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep wrists neutral.
Don't hyperextend elbows.

name: Standing Dumbbell Straight-Arm Front Delt Raise Above Head
beginner_friendly_instructions: Hold dumbbells in front of thighs, palms facing thighs.
Keep arms straight (slight bend in elbows).
Raise dumbbells in an arc overhead.
Lower back down slowly.
injury_prevention_tips: Use light weight.
Don't hyperextend elbows at top.

name: Standing Dumbbell Triceps Extension
beginner_friendly_instructions: Hold one dumbbell with both hands overhead.
Lower dumbbell behind head.
Extend arms to lift dumbbell back up.
Keep elbows pointing forward.
injury_prevention_tips: Don't hyperextend elbows.
Start light.

name: Standing Dumbbell Upright Row
beginner_friendly_instructions: Hold dumbbells in front of thighs, palms facing body.
Pull dumbbells up close to body.
Lead with elbows, lifting them high.
Lower slowly.
injury_prevention_tips: Use lighter weight to protect shoulders.
Stop if you feel shoulder impingement.

name: Standing Elevated Quad Stretch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand facing away from a bench.
Place one foot back on the bench.
Keep standing leg slightly bent.
Push hips forward until stretch is felt in quad.
injury_prevention_tips: Ensure bench is stable.
Don't force the stretch.

name: Standing Front Barbell Raise Over Head
beginner_friendly_instructions: Hold barbell with narrow grip, palms down.
Start with bar at thighs.
Lift bar straight up overhead.
Lower back to thighs.
injury_prevention_tips: Use light weight.
Don't hyperextend elbows at top.

name: Standing Gastrocnemius Calf Stretch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Place one heel on a step.
Keep knee straight.
Lean forward slightly.
Feel stretch in upper calf.
injury_prevention_tips: Hold onto something for balance.
Don't force the stretch.

name: Standing Hamstring and Calf Stretch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Loop band around foot.
Step forward with one leg.
Keep back leg straight.
Pull toes toward you and lean forward.
form_cues: Feel stretch in back of leg.
common_mistakes: Bending knee of front leg too much.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep hips square.
Don't jerk the band.

name: Standing Hip Circles
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand on one leg, hold support.
Lift other knee to hip height.
Move knee out in a large circle.
Repeat for reps, then switch sides.
injury_prevention_tips: Hold onto a stable object.
Warm up before doing large circles.

name: Standing Hip Flexors
beginner_friendly_instructions: Step one foot forward into a lunge.
Keep back leg straight.
Tuck pelvis under.
Push hips forward.
form_cues: Feel stretch in front of hip.
injury_prevention_tips: Don't force the stretch.
Keep knee of front leg aligned.

name: Standing Inner-Biceps Curl
beginner_friendly_instructions: Hold dumbbells with palms facing each other.
Curl weights up and slightly out.
Rotate pinkies up at the top.
Lower slowly.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep wrists neutral.
Don't hyperextend elbows.

name: Standing Lateral Stretch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand with feet wide.
Place one hand on hip.
Reach other arm overhead.
Lean to the side.
injury_prevention_tips: Move slowly.
Don't force the stretch.

name: Standing Leg Curl
beginner_friendly_instructions: Adjust machine pad to back of ankle.
Stand facing machine, hold handles.
Bend knee to curl leg up.
Lower back down.
injury_prevention_tips: Ensure pad is secure.
Don't hyperextend knee at bottom.

name: Standing Low-Pulley Deltoid Raise
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set cable to lowest setting. Stand sideways.
Grab handle with far hand, palm down.
Raise arm out to side to shoulder height.
Lower slowly.
injury_prevention_tips: Use light weight.
Don't go too high (impingement risk).

name: Standing Low-Pulley One-Arm Triceps Extension
beginner_friendly_instructions: Attach a single handle to a low cable pulley.
Stand sideways to the machine, grab the handle with one hand, and step forward to create tension.
Raise the handle overhead, keeping your upper arm vertical and close to your head.
Lower the handle behind your head by bending only your elbow, then extend back up.
form_cues: Keep your elbow pointing at the ceiling; don't let it flare out.
Your upper arm should act like a pendulum; it stays still.
Squeeze your tricep at the top of the movement.
common_mistakes: Moving the elbow forward or backward instead of keeping it vertical.
Using momentum by swinging the torso.
Flaring the elbow out to the side.
injury_prevention_tips: Use a lighter weight to master the elbow isolation; this protects the elbow joint.
Avoid lowering the weight too quickly to prevent tendon strain.

name: Standing Military Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set a barbell at upper chest height on a rack.
Grip the bar slightly wider than shoulder-width and unrack it, resting it on your collarbone.
Step back and stand with feet shoulder-width apart, core braced.
Press the bar straight up overhead until arms are locked, then lower slowly.
form_cues: Squeeze your glutes to keep your lower back stable.
Keep your head neutral; don't hyperextend your neck looking up.
Drive your head through the 'window' of your arms at the top.
common_mistakes: Pressing the bar in a diagonal line (it should go straight up).
Bouncing the weight off the collarbone at the bottom.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep your wrists straight to avoid joint pain.
Brace your abs like youre about to be punched.

name: Standing Olympic Plate Hand Squeeze
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand tall holding a weight plate in each hand with fingertips.
Keep arms extended by your sides.
Slowly lower the plates by extending your fingers.
Curl your fingers back in to lift the plates.
form_cues: Focus on the fingers, not the wrist.
common_mistakes: Using wrist movement instead of finger flexion.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with light plates to avoid finger strain.
Stop if you feel sharp pain in the forearm tendons.

name: Standing One-Arm Cable Curl
beginner_friendly_instructions: Attach a handle to a low cable pulley.
Grab the handle with one hand, step back to create tension, and tuck your non-working hand into your pocket.
Keep your elbow pinned to your side.
Curl the handle up to shoulder height, then lower slowly.
form_cues: Keep your elbow glued to your ribcage.
Squeeze the bicep at the top.
Keep your torso upright; don't lean back.
common_mistakes: Using a grip that is too loose.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep the wrist neutral to avoid tendonitis.
Control the eccentric (lowering) phase.

name: Standing One-Arm Dumbbell Curl Over Incline Bench
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set an incline bench to roughly 45 degrees.
Stand behind it and lean your chest against the top pad.
Hold a dumbbell in one hand with an underhand grip, arm hanging straight down.
Curl the dumbbell up toward your shoulder, then lower slowly.
form_cues: Keep your upper arm vertical throughout.
Press your chest firmly into the pad.
Squeeze the bicep at the top.
common_mistakes: Swinging the torso to lift the weight.
Letting the elbow drift forward or outward.
Lifting the chest off the bench.
injury_prevention_tips: Don't hyperextend the elbow at the bottom.
Use a lighter weight to ensure strict form.

name: Standing One-Arm Dumbbell Triceps Extension
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
Hold a dumbbell overhead with one hand, palm facing forward.
Keep your upper arm vertical and close to your head.
Lower the dumbbell behind your head by bending your elbow, then extend back up.
form_cues: Keep your elbow pointing to the ceiling.
Keep your core tight to avoid arching your back.
common_mistakes: Flaring the elbow out to the side.
Arching the lower back to lift more weight.
injury_prevention_tips: Ensure the dumbbell is secure in your grip.
Avoid dropping the weight behind your head too fast.

name: Standing Overhead Barbell Triceps Extension
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand holding a barbell with a narrow grip (shoulder-width).
Press the bar overhead, arms fully extended.
Keep elbows tucked in and pointing forward.
Lower the bar behind your head by bending elbows, then extend.
form_cues: Keep elbows in; imagine squeezing a pencil between them.
Move only at the elbow joint.
common_mistakes: Using momentum to swing the bar up.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with an EZ-bar or dumbbells if you have wrist issues.
Do not lock out the elbows aggressively at the top.

name: Standing Palm-In One-Arm Dumbbell Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand holding one dumbbell at shoulder height with a neutral grip (palm in).
Place your free hand on a bench or wall for balance.
Press the dumbbell straight up until arm is extended.
Lower back to shoulder height.
form_cues: Keep the dumbbell close to your ear on the way up.
common_mistakes: Pressing in a curved path (keep it vertical).
Shrugging the shoulder at the top.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep the wrist straight and neutral.
Avoid bouncing the weight at the bottom.

name: Standing Palms-In Dumbbell Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height, palms facing in (neutral grip).
Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, core braced.
Press both dumbbells straight up overhead.
Lower them back to shoulder height.
form_cues: Keep your head neutral; don't push your face forward.
Keep dumbbells close to each other at the top.
common_mistakes: Letting the dumbbells drift too far apart.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep wrists neutral to avoid strain.
Don't rush the eccentric phase.

name: Standing Palms-Up Barbell Behind The Back Wrist Curl
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand holding a barbell behind your glutes with an overhand grip (palms facing back).
Keep arms straight by your sides.
Let the barbell roll down your fingers, then curl your wrists up to lift it.
Control the movement back down.
form_cues: Isolate the movement to the wrists.
Squeeze at the top of the wrist flexion.
common_mistakes: Using the shoulders to lift the weight.
injury_prevention_tips: Use a lighter weight to protect wrist tendons.
Warm up wrists before this exercise.

name: Standing Pelvic Tilt
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart, knees slightly bent.
Place hands on hips.
Tilt your pelvis forward (arching lower back slightly), then tilt it backward (tucking tailbone).
Repeat in a smooth, controlled motion.
common_mistakes: Moving the upper body instead of just the pelvis.
injury_prevention_tips: Stop if you feel sharp pain in the lower back.
Keep knees slightly soft to avoid locking.

name: Standing Rope Crunch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Attach a rope to a high pulley.
Face away from the machine, hold the rope ends by your ears/shoulders.
Kneel down or stand with knees slightly bent.
Crunch down by flexing your spine, bringing elbows toward hips.
form_cues: Move through your spine, not your hips.
Keep the movement controlled; don't jerk.
common_mistakes: Pulling with the arms instead of the abs.
Moving the hips back (hinging) instead of flexing the spine.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep your neck neutral; don't pull on your head.
Avoid rounding the back aggressively if you have disc issues.

name: Standing Soleus And Achilles Stretch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand facing a wall, place hands on wall for support.
Step one foot back, keeping heel flat on the ground.
Bend your back knee while keeping the front leg straight.
Hold the stretch, then switch legs.
form_cues: Keep the back leg straight for calf stretch; bend knee for soleus.
common_mistakes: Bending the front knee too much.
injury_prevention_tips: Don't bounce; hold the stretch statically.
Ensure the surface is non-slip.

name: Standing Toe Touches
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart.
Hinge at your hips, keeping legs straight (soft knees allowed).
Let your torso hang down toward the floor.
Hold for time, then stand back up.
form_cues: Keep a slight bend in the knees to protect the lower back.
Hinge at the hips, don't just round the spine.
injury_prevention_tips: Stop at the first sign of sharp pain.
Warm up with light movement first.

name: Standing Towel Triceps Extension
beginner_friendly_instructions: Hold a towel with both hands overhead, arms extended.
Have a partner hold the other end of the towel to provide resistance.
Keep elbows close to your head.
Lower the towel behind your head by bending elbows, then extend.
form_cues: Keep elbows pointing to the ceiling.
common_mistakes: Partner pulling too hard causing loss of control.
injury_prevention_tips: Ensure the towel is sturdy.
Communicate with your partner about resistance level.

name: Step-up with Knee Raise
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand facing a box or bench.
Step up with your left foot, driving through the heel to stand up.
As you stand, drive your right knee up toward your chest.
Step back down and repeat on the other side.
form_cues: Drive through the heel of the standing leg.
common_mistakes: Pushing off the bottom foot too much.
Letting the knee of the standing leg cave inward.
injury_prevention_tips: Choose a height that allows a 90-degree knee angle at the bottom.
Wear secure footwear.

name: Stiff-Legged Barbell Deadlift
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding a barbell with an overhand grip.
Keep a slight bend in your knees (soft).
Hinge at the hips, lowering the bar down your legs while keeping your back straight.
Stop when you feel a stretch in your hamstrings, then drive hips forward to stand.
form_cues: Keep the bar close to your legs.
Push your hips back, not down.
common_mistakes: Bending the knees too much (turning it into a squat).
Letting the bar drift away from the body.
injury_prevention_tips: Do not go heavier than you can control with a flat back.
Stop the movement if you feel a pinch in the lower back.

name: Stiff-Legged Dumbbell Deadlift
beginner_friendly_instructions: Hold a dumbbell in each hand in front of your thighs.
Keep a slight bend in your knees.
Hinge at the hips, lowering dumbbells toward the floor while keeping back straight.
Drive hips forward to return to standing.
form_cues: Keep dumbbells close to your legs.
Feel the stretch in the hamstrings.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep your core braced throughout.
Avoid locking your knees.

name: Stiff Leg Barbell Good Morning
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set a barbell on your upper back (not neck).
Stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
Keep knees slightly bent and back flat.
Hinge at the hips, lowering your torso forward, then drive hips forward to stand.
form_cues: Push hips back, don't just bend over.
Keep the bar stable on your back.
injury_prevention_tips: Start with an empty bar to master the hinge.
Keep the weight light to medium range.

name: Stomach Vacuum
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
Exhale all the air out of your lungs.
Suck your stomach in as hard as you can (navel to spine).
Hold this contraction for 1020 seconds.
common_mistakes: Sucking in the stomach but not contracting deep enough.
injury_prevention_tips: Avoid if you have high blood pressure.
Don't do this while pregnant.

name: Straight-Arm Dumbbell Pullover
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie perpendicular on a flat bench, shoulders on the bench, hips off.
Hold one dumbbell with both hands over your chest.
Keep a slight bend in your elbows.
Lower the dumbbell back behind your head until you feel a chest stretch, then pull back up.
form_cues: Keep elbows slightly bent and fixed.
common_mistakes: Using too much weight (loss of control).
injury_prevention_tips: Ensure the dumbbell is secure (fixed weight preferred).
Don't hyperextend the shoulders at the bottom.

name: Straight-Arm Pulldown
beginner_friendly_instructions: Attach a straight bar to a high pulley.
Grip the bar wide, step back, and lean forward slightly at the hips.
Keep arms straight (slight bend in elbows).
Pull the bar down to your thighs by moving your arms down and back, then return slowly.
common_mistakes: Bending the elbows too much (turning into a pulldown).
injury_prevention_tips: Keep wrists neutral.
Don't use too heavy a weight.

name: Straight Bar Bench Mid Rows
beginner_friendly_instructions: Place a loaded barbell on a bench.
Stand on the bench behind the bar, feet straddling it.
Grip the bar with a medium grip.
Row the bar to your torso by retracting shoulder blades and bending elbows.
common_mistakes: Using only arms, not back muscles.
injury_prevention_tips: Ensure the bench is stable.
Keep a neutral spine.

name: Straight Raises on Incline Bench
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie face down on an incline bench.
Hold a barbell on the floor with straight arms (pronated grip).
Keep arms straight and raise the barbell up in front of you.
Lower back down slowly.
common_mistakes: Using momentum to swing the weight up.
injury_prevention_tips: Use light weight.
Avoid if you have shoulder impingement.

name: Sumo Deadlift
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand with feet very wide, toes pointed slightly out.
Grip the barbell inside your legs with a mixed or overhand grip.
Sink your hips down, keep chest up, back flat.
Drive through the floor, stand up tall, dragging the bar up your legs.
form_cues: Keep the bar close to your shins.
common_mistakes: Starting with hips too low or too high.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep your spine neutral; don't hyperextend at the top.
Ensure your knees track over your toes.

name: Sumo Deadlift with Bands
beginner_friendly_instructions: Loop resistance bands under your feet and over the barbell.
Set up with a wide sumo stance.
Grip the bar inside your legs.
Perform the deadlift as usual, fighting the band tension.
form_cues: Drive hips forward at the top.
common_mistakes: Rounding the back due to heavy bands.
Letting the bands snap back uncontrolled.
injury_prevention_tips: Secure the bands properly.
Don't let the bar bounce at the bottom.

name: Sumo Deadlift with Chains
beginner_friendly_instructions: Drape chains over the barbell so they hang off the sleeves.
Set up with a wide sumo stance.
Grip the bar inside your legs.
Perform the deadlift; the weight increases as you lift.
form_cues: Keep the chains from hitting the floor plates.
Keep the bar close to the body.
common_mistakes: Chains hitting the plates on the way down.
Jerking the weight off the floor.
injury_prevention_tips: Ensure chains are balanced.
Start lighter than usual.

name: Superman
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie face down on the floor with arms extended forward.
Simultaneously lift your arms, chest, and legs off the floor.
Squeeze your lower back and glutes.
Hold for a second, then lower back down.
form_cues: Look at the floor, not up (keeps neck safe).
common_mistakes: Only lifting legs but not the chest.
injury_prevention_tips: Stop if you feel pinching in the lower back.
Keep the movement range within comfort.

name: Suspended Fallout
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set suspension straps to waist height.
Grab handles and lean forward into a plank position.
Keep arms straight and core tight.
Extend your arms forward, lowering your body toward the floor, then pull back.
form_cues: Keep your body in a straight line.
common_mistakes: Going too deep for your current strength.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep the range of motion controlled.
Avoid if you have anterior shoulder pain.

name: Suspended Push-Up
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set suspension straps to mid-chest height.
Grab handles and get into a plank position.
Keep your body rigid.
Lower your chest between your hands, then push back up.
injury_prevention_tips: Adjust foot position to make it easier/harder.
Don't let the straps slip.

name: Suspended Reverse Crunch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set straps to foot height.
Place feet in handles, get into a plank position.
Keep body straight.
Bring knees toward your chest by flexing hips and knees, then extend back.
form_cues: Round your lower back slightly at the top.
Move from the hips, not just bending knees.
common_mistakes: Just bending knees without hip flexion.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep the movement controlled.
Stop if you feel back strain.

name: Suspended Row
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set suspension straps to chest height.
Grab handles and lean back, body straight.
Pull your chest toward your hands by bending elbows.
Extend arms back to start.
form_cues: Keep your body straight like a board.
common_mistakes: Pulling with the arms only (not back).
injury_prevention_tips: Don't let the straps slip.
Keep wrists neutral.

name: Suspended Split Squat
beginner_friendly_instructions: Set suspension straps to foot height.
Face away from the anchor, place one foot in the handle.
Step forward with your standing leg.
Lower yourself down by bending the knee, then drive back up.
form_cues: Keep your front knee tracking over your foot.
common_mistakes: Letting the front knee cave inward.
injury_prevention_tips: Ensure the strap is secure.
Start with a low range of motion.

name: Svend Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand tall holding two weight plates together in front of your chest.
Squeeze the plates hard together.
Press the plates straight out in front of you.
Bring them back to your chest slowly.
form_cues: Squeeze the plates as hard as possible.
common_mistakes: Losing the squeeze on the plates.
injury_prevention_tips: Use light plates.
Keep wrists neutral.

name: T-Bar Row with Handle
beginner_friendly_instructions: Load one end of a barbell into a landmine or corner.
Straddle the bar and attach a double D-handle.
Hinge at the hips, keep chest up, back flat.
Row the handle to your upper abdomen, then lower slowly.
common_mistakes: Using biceps too much instead of back.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep your core braced.
Don't overload the weight.

name: Tate Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on a flat bench holding dumbbells over your chest, palms facing each other.
Let your elbows flare out to the sides.
Lower the dumbbells toward your upper chest by bending elbows.
Press back up, keeping dumbbells close together.
common_mistakes: Tucking elbows in (turns into a press).
Flaring elbows too wide causing shoulder strain.
injury_prevention_tips: Use moderate weight.
Don't let the dumbbells drift over your face.

name: The Straddle
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on the floor with legs wide apart in a V shape.
Sit up tall.
Hinge at the hips and lean forward.
Hold the stretch.
form_cues: Keep back flat as you hinge.
injury_prevention_tips: Don't force the stretch.
Warm up hips first.

name: Thigh Abductor
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on the abductor machine.
Place legs against the pads.
Push legs apart against the resistance.
Return slowly to the start.
form_cues: Keep your back against the pad.
common_mistakes: Using momentum to swing the weight.
injury_prevention_tips: Don't use a weight that forces you to jerk.
Keep feet neutral.

name: Thigh Adductor
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit on the adductor machine.
Place legs against the outside pads.
Bring legs together against the resistance.
Return slowly to the start.
form_cues: Keep your back against the pad.
Squeeze inner thighs at the bottom.
injury_prevention_tips: Don't use a weight that forces you to jerk.
Keep feet neutral.

name: Toe Touchers
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on your back with legs straight up in the air.
Arms extended toward your toes.
Lift your shoulders and torso off the floor to reach toward your toes.
Lower back down.
form_cues: Keep lower back pressed into the floor.
Keep legs as straight as possible.
common_mistakes: Lifting the lower back off the floor.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep the movement controlled.
Stop if you feel neck strain.

name: Torso Rotation
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand holding a medicine ball or exercise ball with arms extended.
Rotate your torso to one side.
Rotate back through center to the other side.
Repeat.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep the weight light.
Warm up the spine first.

name: Trap Bar Deadlift
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand inside a trap bar (hex bar) loaded with weight.
Grip both handles.
Sink your hips down, keep chest up, back flat.
Drive through the floor to stand up tall.
form_cues: Keep the bar close to your body.
common_mistakes: Starting with hips too high (turning into a stiff leg).
Jerking the weight off the floor.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep your spine neutral.
Ensure the bar is balanced.

name: Tricep Dumbbell Kickback
beginner_friendly_instructions: Bend over, supporting yourself with one hand on a bench.
Hold a dumbbell in the other hand, elbow tucked to your side.
Extend your arm straight back until it's level with your torso.
Return to the start.
form_cues: Keep your upper arm parallel to the floor.
Keep your elbow pinned to your side.
Squeeze the tricep at the top.
common_mistakes: Moving the upper arm up or down.
Using the shoulder to lift the weight.
injury_prevention_tips: Use light weight.
Keep the wrist straight.

name: Tricep Side Stretch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand or sit tall.
Reach one arm overhead, bend the elbow, and drop hand behind your head.
Use the other hand to gently pull the elbow further back/down.
Hold, then switch sides.
injury_prevention_tips: Be gentle with the joint.
Don't force the stretch.

name: Triceps Overhead Extension with Rope
beginner_friendly_instructions: Attach a rope to a low pulley.
Face away from the machine, hold the rope overhead with elbows bent.
Keep elbows pointing forward.
Extend arms fully overhead, then lower back down.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep wrists neutral.
Don't lock out elbows aggressively.

name: Triceps Pushdown
beginner_friendly_instructions: Attach a straight bar to a high pulley.
Grip the bar with an overhand grip, elbows tucked at your sides.
Push the bar down until arms are straight.
Control the return.
form_cues: Keep elbows glued to your sides.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep wrists straight.
Don't use a weight that forces you to swing.

name: Triceps Pushdown - Rope Attachment
beginner_friendly_instructions: Attach a rope to a high pulley.
Grip the rope with a neutral grip (palms facing each other), elbows tucked.
Push the rope down until arms are straight, separating the rope ends at the bottom.
Control the return.
form_cues: Twist the rope outward at the bottom.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep wrists neutral.
Control the eccentric.

name: Triceps Pushdown - V-Bar Attachment
beginner_friendly_instructions: Attach a V-bar to a high pulley.
Grip the bar with a neutral grip (palms facing in), elbows tucked.
Push the bar down until arms are straight.
Control the return.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep wrists neutral.
Don't overload the weight.

name: Triceps Stretch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Raise one arm overhead, bend elbow so hand drops behind head.
Use the other hand to gently push the elbow down/back.
Hold the stretch.
Switch sides.
form_cues: Feel the stretch in the back of the arm.
injury_prevention_tips: Be gentle with the joint.
Don't force range of motion.

name: Tuck Crunch
beginner_friendly_instructions: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet off the floor.
Cross your ankles (tuck).
Place hands on chest or behind head.
Lift your shoulders off the floor, bringing knees toward chest, then lower.
form_cues: Keep lower back on the floor.
common_mistakes: Lifting the lower back off the floor.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep the movement controlled.
Stop if you feel neck strain.

name: Dumbbell Preacher Curl
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit at a preacher bench with a dumbbell in one hand, armpit pressed firmly against the pad.
Fully extend your arm down, feeling a stretch in your bicep.
Curl the dumbbell up towards your shoulder, keeping your upper arm completely still.
Squeeze your bicep at the top, then slowly lower back to the start.
form_cues: Keep your armpit glued to the pad.
Do not swing your body to lift the weight.
Squeeze at the top for a full second.
common_mistakes: Using momentum by swinging the torso.
Lifting the upper arm off the pad.
Shortening the range of motion by not fully extending at the bottom.
injury_prevention_tips: Do not fully lock out your elbow at the bottom to protect the joint.
Start with a light weight to avoid bicep tendon strain.

name: Two-Arm Kettlebell Clean
beginner_friendly_instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart with a kettlebell between your feet.
Hinge at your hips and grab the kettlebell with both hands.
Explosively extend your hips and knees to pull the kettlebell upward.
As it rises, pull the kettlebell close to your body and 'catch' it at shoulder height with palms facing in.
form_cues: Keep the kettlebell close to your body.
Punch your hips back (hinge) to start the movement.
Keep your wrists strong when you catch the weight.
common_mistakes: Letting the kettlebell drift away from the body (causes shoulder strain).
Relying only on arms instead of hip drive.
Bending the wrists backward when catching the weight.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep your core braced to protect your lower back.
Start with a lighter weight to master the 'clean' motion without banging your forearm.

name: Two-Arm Kettlebell Jerk
beginner_friendly_instructions: Clean two kettlebells to the rack position (resting on forearms, palms facing in).
Bend your knees slightly, then explosively drive up through your legs.
Press the kettlebells overhead, splitting your legs (one foot forward, one back).
Bring your feet back together to stand upright with arms locked out.
form_cues: Drive through the floor with your legs.
Keep your core tight throughout the movement.
Lock your elbows at the top.
common_mistakes: Pressing with arms only without using leg drive.
Not locking the elbows out fully.
Losing balance by not splitting the feet properly.
injury_prevention_tips: Ensure you have the shoulder mobility to press overhead safely.
Practice the movement without weight before adding load.

name: Two-Arm Kettlebell Military Press
beginner_friendly_instructions: Clean two kettlebells to the rack position (palms facing in).
Brace your core and squeeze your glutes.
Press the kettlebells straight up until arms are locked out.
Lower them slowly back to the rack position.
form_cues: Keep your ribs down (don't flare them).
Press your head through slightly at the top.
Keep the kettlebells close to your face.
common_mistakes: Letting the kettlebells drift too far forward.
Shrugging the shoulders at the top.
injury_prevention_tips: Keep your wrist straight to avoid strain.
Do not flare your elbows out excessively; keep them slightly forward.

name: Two-Arm Kettlebell Row
beginner_friendly_instructions: Place kettlebells on the floor in front of you.
Hinge at your hips and place your free hand on a bench for support.
Pull the kettlebells up towards your hip, driving your elbow back.
Lower the kettlebells slowly until your arm is fully extended.
form_cues: Keep your back flat like a table.
Pull with your elbows, not your hands.
Squeeze your shoulder blades at the top.
common_mistakes: Jerking the weight up with momentum.
Shrugging the shoulders up to the ears.
injury_prevention_tips: Maintain a neutral spine throughout the movement.
Keep your neck in line with your spine (don't look up).

name: Underhand Cable Pulldowns
beginner_friendly_instructions: Sit at the lat pulldown machine and secure your knees under the pads.
Grab the bar with an underhand grip (palms facing you), slightly narrower than shoulder-width.
Pull the bar down to your upper chest, driving your elbows down and back.
